Title: Applied Scientist
Description: Description  At Amazon, we are committed to being the Earth’s most customer-centric company. The International Technology group (InTech) owns the enhancement and delivery of Amazon’s cutting-edge engineering to all the varied customers and cultures of the world. We do this through a combination of partnerships with other Amazon technical teams and our own innovative new projects.  You will be joining the EU Lifecycle team is to evolve the onsite experience by understanding and serving the needs of customers at each stage of their relationship with Amazon. You will contribute to doing this by helping us identify the right promotions to show a customer given their interests and intent on Amazon using challenging machine learning and data analysis solutions. You will be exposed to cutting edge big data and machine learning technologies and you'll be part of a key effort to improve our customers experience.  We are looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive Scientist with a strong machine learning background to help build industry-leading machine learning solutions. As the successful applicant for this role, you will with work closely with your business partners to identify opportunities for innovation. You will apply machine learning solutions to automate manual processes, to scale existing systems, to name just a few. You will own the definition, training and validation of the machine learning models, and you will work closely with the software engineering team to deploy and operate these models at scale.  Your work will improve the experience of millions of daily customers using Amazon in Europe and in other regions. You will have the chance to have great customer impact and continue growing in one of the most innovative companies in the world. You will learn a huge amount - and have a lot of fun - in the process!   Basic Qualifications  M.Sc. or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field. 3+ years of hands-on experience in designing, developing and assessing new solutions using machine learning techniques. Proficiency with Python. Knowledge of Software Development (data structures, algorithms, etc) with experience in Java, C, C++ or other object-oriented language. Results oriented person with a delivery focus. Preferred Qualifications  Ph.D. in Machine Learning. Experience with Machine Learning applied to e-commerce experiences. Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.  Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  #NicheTech #NicheTechESP   Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L. Job ID: A1160548
Industries: Software, Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Internet

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description: Who We Are  At Vistaprint, we believe that everything we do has a lasting impact on our customers and on each other. It begins and ends with a passion for helping our customers succeed. To give them our best, we empower our teams with the autonomy they need to make smarter decisions and pursue higher value. We thrive on exploration, collaboration, and helping every customer grow their business beyond imagination. Fueled by technology and innovation, we are so much more than business cards.  What You Will Do  As a specialist in the customer care analytics domain, you will help create machine learning-based cutting edge tools to enable our customer service teams to create the best experiences for our customers and contribute to our growth. Partner within the multi-disciplinary data product teams to develop great analytics-based data productsWilling to take over development of other data products in the commercial or manufacturing space of Vistaprint in the futureInteract regularly with other Data Scientists to discuss technical feedback on your work and provide technical feedback on their workBuild new models, as well as analyze and improve pre-existing models and algorithmsPrioritizing and completing the backlog of improvements envisioned for the current data product  Your Qualifications Degree in computer science, math/statistics, or another technical field3+ years of advanced machine learning and modeling experienceFamiliarity with NLP (Natural Language Processing) techniquesProficiency in at least one data science programming language (Python, R, Scala) and SQLProficiency in model development, model validation and model implementation for large-scale applications  Nice To Have Familiarity with techniques in Recommender Systems, Information Retrieval, Learning To Rank etc.Entrepreneurial Data Engineering chops to deliver proof of concepts end to endGood knowledge of data visualization theory and tools (e.g. Tableau, looker, plotly, ggplot, etc.)Experience in the customer care environment and relevant technologies,Agile working methodologyRelevant work in an e-commerce environment  Why You’ll Love Working Here  At Vistaprint, we put great importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure a phenomenal work/life balance. Perks include flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, commuter benefits and very generous time off, including our unique sabbatical-like program, “Vistabreak”, to name a few!  About Us  As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.
Industries: Internet, Marketing y publicidad, Ingeniería industrial o mecánica

Title: Data Scientist
Description: En estos momentos precisamos incorporar un perfil Data Scientist para un cliente muy importante del sector E-Commerce ubicado en Alcobendas.  Funciones Análisis de los datos recopilados en proyectos de implantación Big Data.Recoger y analizar grandes cantidades de datos en distintos formatos: y convertir todos estos datos en información útil y relevante para la compañía.Gestión de grandes bases de datos distribuidas y crear planes de análisis de datos en entornos masivos relacionados con la temática del eCommerce. Requisitos Debe de tener un perfil técnico avanzado: saber sobre programación, para interactuar con las bases de datos: y contar con conocimientos específicos de las bibliotecas de análisis de datos.Conocimientos en Scala, Spark.Conocimientos base de datos MongoDB.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Telecomunicaciones, Recursos humanos

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Our client is looking for a senior data scientist to join their hyper growth ed-tech marketplace platform. Whilst many companies have found 2020 a difficult year, our client, which offers video based education learning is going through it`s biggest user growth rate of its 7 year history and will be expanding its e-learning platform to new verticals for the remainder of the year and beyond. The position should be exciting for someone looking for something of a turning point in their career where they would like to work on a product with purpose and great value to millions around the world . Furthermore it should appeal to someone exicted to be part of a company transitioning from successful start up to globally scaled platform and being a key team member in this transition.  The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.  ResponsibilitiesAnalyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processingDesign accurate and scalable prediction algorithmsCollaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to productionGenerate actionable insights for business improvements QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelingDeep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithmsFluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)
Industries: Internet

Title: Data Scientist Madrid/Barcelona/Bilbao
Description: About Accenture  Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.  We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.  With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.  Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.  About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence  Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.  The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.  Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.  Data Scientist role:  You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital technologies. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.  Your Goals   Your objective would be to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of predictive process control   Your role will require the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline   Develop innovative thought leadership and contribute to the creation of points of view on re-usable models in Supply Chain.  Key Responsibilities   Responsible for the development of predictive models and the generation of data-driven insights to solve industrial problems or challenges.   You’ll be responsible for development, training and validation of mentioned models, and the visualization of the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.   Manage and manipulate data sets, including: variables definition, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business needs.   Outline and structure the project tasks and best approach, along with team senior members, from the detailed understanding of client’s problem statement and their specific business requirements.   Provide specific training and guidance to development factory to ensure data integration activities around base and feature-enriched tables align with the analytical models.   Develop and maintain analytical models.   Demonstrate a high degree of ownership, accountability for your output and commitment to the task.   Mentor and train junior developers and modelers.   Support Management team on client proposals and other sales activities.   Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with offshore development teams and provide guidance to ensure quality deliverables.  Skills you will need:   You should have working knowledge of process data visualization, statistics/statistical testing, machine learning, data mining, and database structure and management.   Passion in statistical analysis.   Critical thinking and attention to detail.   Statistical analysis/programming in tools like R, SAS, PYTHON, SCADA, Spark, MATLAB, Tensor Flow, Torch, Caffe, Excel, CNTK.   Knowledge in visualization tools like Shiny, Spotfire, Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI.  Knowledge of full life cycle development methodologies
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Telecomunicaciones, Recursos humanos

Title: Data Scientist Junior (Python & GCP)
Description: ¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestra familia!UST Global se preocupa por la seguridad de sus empleados y, ahora más que nunca dada la nueva situación, hemos reforzado nuestras operaciones. UST ofrece teletrabajo a los empleados y también otras modalidades de conciliación con las que podrás acumular suficiente tiempo para equilibrar tu vida personal y laboral. UST Global además, cree fuertemente en la Diversidad y la Inclusión como la forma de mejorar su fuerza de trabajo operacional, por lo que si tienes Certificado de Discapacidad, esta es tu empresa!Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST Global es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer con más de 20.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 25 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías a través de proyectos end-to-end, consultoría y soluciones propias. ¿Qué buscamos?Para nuestro equipo de Big Data y Data Scientists estamos buscando incorporar un Data Scientist junior con experiencia con Python y Google Cloud Platform. Funciones-Desarrollar proyectos basados en datos utilizando tecnología Big Data y técnicas de ciencia de datos.-Selección, definición y ejecución de los entornos de programación adecuados, formatos de archivo, soluciones de almacenamiento de datos, flujos de datos automáticos.-Definir y seguir las mejores prácticas para los casos de uso de Big Data mientras extrae, transforma, almacena y alimenta datos a o desde diferentes fuentes de datos.-Conocer y mantenerse actualizado de las últimas técnicas, modelos, entornos de programación y enfoques técnicos para diferentes problemas de Data Science. Requisitos:-Mínimo 2 años de experiencia como Data Scientist con Python-Experiencia con Google Cloud Platform implementando servicios Big Data-Experiencia con tecnologías Data movement CDAP,Informatica,Talend, Nifi, Kafka y Google Data Fusion.-Grado en informática o disciplinas científicas/técnicas relacionadas-Inglés intermedio Deseable y valorable: Poseer Certificado de discapacidad, en grado igual o superior al 33%  ¿Qué te ofrecemos?Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación para que tengas acceso a un amplio catálogo multidisciplinar.Estabilidad y carrera profesional dentro de nuestro Centro de Excelencia donde podrás participar dando cobertura a varios proyectos de la compañía.Entorno internacional y contacto directo con compañeros referentes en las tecnologías core de la compañía, con los que podrás compartir conocimientos.Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas del que podrás beneficiarte al referenciar profesionales que se incorporen a la compañía. Y además…23 días laborables de vacaciones y jornada intensiva en verano.Salario competitivo y beneficios sociales (tarjeta restaurante y seguro de accidentes).Programa de Retribución Flexible para que puedas adaptar tu retribución según tus intereses (cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online con profesores nativos, seguro médico…).Horario flexible y teletrabajo por proyecto, actualmente por la situación actual se ofrece jornada completa con teletrabajo y otras medidas de conciliación.Tarifa plana con los gimnasios que tú elijas, cerca de tu domicilio o de las oficinas.Fruta en la oficina.Te damos vacaciones los días de Nochebuena y Nochevieja. Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición, ¡te estamos esperando!
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: Data Scientist
Description: We are now looking for an Semantic Analyst or Data Scientist to join our high talented and multidisciplinary team working for international European institutions.   What do we offer?   You will be assigned to different projects, normally for well-known international European public institutions, where studies or analysis to be developed are linked to semantics and interoperability research.  You will enjoy working in an informal atmosphere with a young but highly skilled team of professionals and with well-known semantic experts that will help you grow in your knowledge career.  Do you like travelling around Europe? Although Barcelona will be your main location, this project offers you the opportunity to visit different countries and meet with colleagues and customers abroad.    Furthermore...   Paid official certifications in specific technologies. Free language courses. Work-life balance with flexibility of schedules, shorter summer and Fridays work days, or teleworking under some conditions are among some of the measures to accommodate your hobbies and activities to your work activity. Company benefit plans (healthcare, meals, insurance, gym discounts and other perks). Participation in periodic semantics-related events and scientific conferences.   Mandatory knowledge and experience   Knowledge in semantic technologies (Semantic Web, Linked Open Data, NLP techniques…) Knowledge in interoperability standards (e.g. XML, XSD, XSL-T, RDF, OWL) Knowledge in data models and their end-to-end management (Taxonomy and Ontology development) Knowledge of at least one programming language (Java is preferable) High English level (at least, B2)  Academic requirements   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related quantitative discipline.   Nice to have (from more to less importance):   Previous experience in semantic projects Knowledge in methodologies about information and knowledge management Knowledge in machine-learning or other AI technologies   At everis, we believe everyone is unique and different, this is why we bet for an inclusive culture that recognizes and values diversity. We work day after day to create an environment in which we can explore, live and enhance our own singularity.     #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique
Industries: Software, Administración gubernamental

Title: Data Scientist - New Games
Description: Job Description  We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of games analytics within our New Games studio, who work across London, Stockholm and Barcelona. You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, to generate value for the studio's new generation of awesome mobile games, including Crash Bandicoot: On The Run! Your Role Within our Kingdom As a Data Scientist, you will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.  Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impact  Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games  Provide insights to support decision making for the portfolio of games in the Studio  Work closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple games  Help evolve the methodology and tools available to King’s data science community  Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications   Skills to Create Thrills There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.  Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:  Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the most appropriate data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions  Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous  SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.  Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposes  Stats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.   Bonus Points  Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businesses  Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)  Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design  Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas  Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)  Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.   A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heros Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people that share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. No matter where you’re from, it’s all about what we can achieve together when creating truly magical moments for all our players. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent - because a great saga needs all sorts of heroes. Apply Now Want to join our Kingdom?  Application needs to be in English.  Apply now!
Industries: Videojuegos, Software, Entretenimiento

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Our opportunity  You will join the Data Science and Advanced Analytics (DSAA) Team, part of Enterprise Data Analytics & Architecture (EDAA) within Group Operations (GO). The DSAA team consists of data scientists who are passionate about the solutions that we build and the impact that we have in transforming and enabling Zurich as a data-driven organization. Our team is responsible for delivering cutting edge data science solutions, services and environments to internal customers: Business Units and Group Functions alike, giving you the opportunity to have a global impact.  In the role of Data Scientist, you will join a dynamic and agile team providing services, including designing, developing and maintaining systems in support of data science and advanced analytics processes.  Your role  As a Data Scientist Your Main Responsibilities Will Involve  Analytical acumen: Designing, developing, testing and maintaining applications for data science & advanced analytics processes: including applied data science techniques: Deep/Machine Learning, NLP (text or voice) and Computer Vision Critical thinking and problem-solving: You leverage data to develop predictive models and algorithms and work with business stakeholders to craft and defend actionable solutions to real-world business challengesCommunicating: You have strong written: verbal and presentation communication skills and you excel at telling stories with data to audiences of all typesBeing self-driven: You show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data. You push yourself to exceed goals by recognizing what needs to be done, identifying an approach, communicating and prioritizing accordingly. You are results and solution oriented.Technical acumen: You are comfortable working in and have an advanced knowledge & high degree of competence with a range of programming languages (you should eat and sleep Python: R / SQL are nice to have too) / technologies combined with a desire and aptitude to broaden that experience. You also are comfortable with Agile & DevOps practices.   Teamwork: You are ready to become a key part of an agile, fast-paced, collaborative and production-oriented team.   Your Skills And Experience  As a Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:  University level education, e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Discipline  Desired: PhD or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in a relevant technical field such as computer science, statistics, machine learning or mathematics. At least 3 years relevant industry experience as an applied Data Scientist or Data Engineer in an advanced analytics / data science environment  Preferred: Insurance knowledge and experience. Extensive experience applying advance analytics / machine learning to design, develop, implement and deploy data-driven productsProven track record of programming skills:  Required: Python, R, SQLDesired: Scala, Spark Experience with Agile methodologies & DevOps practicesExperience working in cloud environments is a plus, especially AzureAbility to work effectively in a global organization, even when under time pressure   Fluent in English (spoken and written)   Additional Information  Primary work location is Barcelona. This position might require occasional travelling. You can apply by clicking on the button “Apply online”  Who We Are  At Zurich we highly value the experience and know-how of our employees. The responsibility for your professional development lies in your hands and we support your need for progression and change by offering a wide range of opportunities across all business areas.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Recursos humanos

Title: Data Scientist Healthcare
Description: benshi.ai's mission is to improve the health of individuals and populations in resource-poor countries through advanced AI applications. We seek for data scientists to push the boundaries of AI in Global Digital Health. We are interested in individuals with a solid background in statistical modeling, machine learning and analytical techniques, with experience in applying those techniques in clinical data and healthcare settings. You will be carrying out research on predictive models and recommendation systems using available data, and defining the best course of action in clinical trials, treatment personalization and other solutions to address healthcare needs, as part of our data science team. If you are passionate about using data science to improve health outcomes, and are excited about using your skills to improve the world, we want to meet you! Responsibilities: Development of data science models to predict and to understand human behavior, to personalize treatment and diagnosis, with the goal of being included in production in our machine learning platformIdentify and formulate problems that address health inequities and independently conduct high-quality research Minimum qualifications: BSc/BEng degree in mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, life sciences, physics, computer science, epidemiology, machine learning or related fields: or equivalent technical proficiencyExperience in clinical AI, and/or data science or machine learning for healthcare or digital healthSolid coding skills in Python or R Preferred qualifications: MSc/MEng or PhD in mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, life sciences, physics, computer science, data science, health outcomes, epidemiology, machine learning or related fields: or equivalent research experienceKnowledge about the application of data science and AI technologies in areas relevant to healthcare: population health assessment, epidemiology, clinical trial research, gamification for healthcare, clinical decision support, machine learning-based behavioral modification and/or medical supply chain optimizationExperience with healthcare data and EHRExperience in clinical trial assessment and/or causal inference for healthcareExperience in deep learning and its frameworks (TensorFlow, Keras, Caffe, Theano...)Experience in time series forecasting, survival analysis, ensemble learning, recommendation systems and/or natural language processingExperience with databricks and machine learning lifecycle management tools (e.g. mlflow)  More information at https://benshi.ai
Industries: Investigación

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Data Engineers influence how empathy.co does business, one data-driven decision at a time! In this role, you’ll develop software, data pipelines and applications to apply mathematical algorithms to data and perform large scale data reduction and analysis.Your work will inform, influence and support business decisions and product design. You’ll also be involved in the design, development, and implementation of high performance and easy-to-use data visualisations and automation scripts.  WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?A committed, enthusiastic and open minded individual with the capacity to empathize with our customers. Someone who is not afraid to ask questions and always keen to learn and improve. A motivated self-starter who loves a challenge and is always pushing themselves, their ideas, and the norm.As a part of one of the market leaders and a fast-growing company, you will have the opportunity to direct and lead our path while reaching millions of users with your innovations.Position based out of Gijón / A Coruña / Remote.  KEY SKILLSDegree in Computer Science or related fields (i.e. Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computational Neuroscience).2+ years of experience designing and building backend systems (preferably oriented towards the processing of large volumes of data).Deep fluency in at least one backend programming language (Python 3+, Java 8, Scala, etc.).Analytical mindset to identify issues and opportunities.Excellent spoken and written english. BONUS POINTSAn advanced degree (MsC, PhD) in a specialisation is preferred.Machine learning and deep learning knowledge and experience.Hands-on experience developing microservices based architectures and the technologies that enable them (containers, REST APIs, messaging queues, etc.).Experience with distributed frameworks like Apache Spark or Apache Hadoop.Experience with the following technologies: MongoDB, Cassandra, ELK Solr, Redis…Experience with Team collaboration tools such as Git, Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence, etc.Experience with unit testing and continuous integration.Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. BENEFITSOpportunity to attend tech courses, events and conferences worldwideFlexible working hours & Possibility to work from home.2.5K Training Budget per year.Reduced working hours on a Friday and during the summer monthsPrivate medical insuranceFree English lessons at the officeHigh-end gear: a 13-inch MacBook Pro with dual monitor setup and the IDE of your choiceWorking with cutting-edge technologiesUnlimited fruit, coffee and tea. And most importantly: an amazing working atmosphere and team culture

Title: Junior Data Scientist for search project
Description: Job Description  Number 1 in Europe!  zooplus AG was founded in Munich in 1999 and today it is Europe's leading e-tailer for pet food and pet supplies. With an annual double-digit growth rate and a revenue about 1.111 million Euro in 2017, we have already successfully rolled out our business model in 29 European countries and we are expecting further sustainable growth in European e-commerce.  Our employees are the key to our success!  The zooplus team currently consists of 500 interdisciplinary specialists and managers from more than 40 countries who work at 11 international sites in the Sales & Marketing, IT, Operations and Administration departments. So we can remain successful against our competitors in the future too, we are looking for individuals who can develop our business and help create a positive corporate culture by not only demonstrating versatile professional and methodological expertise, but also by showing a passion for performance, analysis and a solution-based approach. This includes dealing with rapid changes, intensive networking and an in-depth understanding of technology, the digital market and the business model's value-added chain.  Responsibilities  Working with other data scientists and engineers to design and implement new internal search solution Developing infrastructure for cleaning and processing data and running experiments to evaluate system performance Performing error analysis and suggesting and implementing improvements Participating in development and design of the internal recommendation system Communication of your results to stakeholders  Creation of a new information retrieval system to enable semantic search using multiple document interpretations  Automatic extraction of causal knowledge from varied information sources such as product descriptions, magazine articles, etc.   Requirements  Profile  University degree computer science, mathematics or similar Experience working with data Being familiar with core Machine Learning concepts and being able to code them  Being familiar with data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Ability and desire to go through large amounts of unstructured information to discover trends and patterns Experience with any Python/Scala/Lua and familiarity with modern Deep Learning Frameworks such as Pytorch or Tensorflow or MXNet Willingness to provide tangible outcomes delivered to stakeholders Structured and solution-oriented way of working Team player who likes to work in a dynamic work environment Desire to work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions Desire to take part in design and hands-on implementation of recommendation systems Desire to take part in design and hands-on implementation of personalized search solution with semantic understanding Desire and ability to read, understand and apply scientific research papers   What We Are Offering You  Competitive salary 28 days’ vacation (plus Dec 24 and 31 when they fall on a labor day) Medical insurance with a dental plan Flexible working hours Free drinks and fresh fruit Discount in Zooplus shop

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Purpose of the function:We are seeking a passionate Data Engineer to join our Corporate Analytics Team. Description of the position:Together with Corporate Analytics Team, you are playing the main role for the further development of our current analytics platform and making data available for various analytics projects and business units.  Key Responsibilities and tasks: Ingest data from different data sources into our analytics platformCreate data pipelines (batch, real-time is upcoming), e.g. IoT data, SAP data: across different staging and deployment environmentsIntegrate new cloud platform servicesOperate the hybrid (on-premises and AZURE cloud) analytics platform incl. build pipelinesContribute to the definition of data architecture standards and establish best practices for data managementDesign and implement data models driven by data science use cases and in the future productive deployment of ML models Working Experience: More than 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role.Willing to learn. Professional skills: Mandatory skills: Strong SQL scripting skillsHands-on ETL experience using SSIS, others are a bonusExperience of working with Cloud PlatformsExperience with implementation and administration of modern Big Data services, preferably on the Azure stack (Databricks, Data Factory, Data Lake)Experience of working with Spark (Scala, PySpark, SparkSQL)Used to work with agile methods and tools e.g. AZURE DevOps, ConfluenceAbility to prioritize tasks and manage to work in multiple projectsProvide technical guidance to other members of a project team Additional skills non mandatory, but valuable for the position: Experience in designing CI/CD pipelinesSolid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices (e.g. Data Mart, Data Lakes)Experience with SAP systems as a data sourceUsed to work in a remote team Personal skills: Excited about solving problemsGreat willingness to learn, creativity, reliability as well as commitmentTeam player, Collaborative and easy to deal withStrong communication skillsQuality awareness (someone who pays attention to the details and quality of his/her work)Client focused / Customer-driven mindset  Full job description at our website: http://montareloconsulting.com/W1/blog/2020/02/03/data-engineer/

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Who we are: Chartboost is the leading in-app monetization and programmatic advertising platform. We reach a mobile audience of over 900 million monthly unique users globally and process over 200 billion ad requests. The Chartboost SDK is the highest-integrated independent mobile ad SDK and through the Chartboost Exchange, Ad Network, DSP and other services, we empower mobile app developers to build businesses, while connecting advertisers to highly engaged audiences. We’re rapidly growing and looking for passionate people to expand our team in Barcelona. About the job: We are seeking world-class data pipeline engineers to join our team, helping us build and maintain a data platform that supports diverse uses — including data analysis, exploration, aggregation, and external & internal APIs — delivering significant value to our game developers, advertisers and internal clients. In this role you are expected to be comfortable working to high standards as a professional data engineer, dealing with huge amounts of business-critical data (hundreds of TBs), and to contribute across a full spectrum of responsibilities from architecture to ops.Our stack currently includes Spark, Presto, Qubole, EMR, Cloudera, Hive, Kafka, Airflow, Scala, Python, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Spinnaker, and Kubernetes, running in AWS. You will also have opportunities to join us in exploring new technologies and use them to design, deploy and operate highly performant systems.  As part of a startup you will be a key player in our small, nimble, internationally-distributed team and drive significant impact all across the company's data technology and business. What you’ll do: Develop high-quality reliable data pipelines that convert data streams into valuable informationDesign, implement and deploy both real time and batch data processing pipelines for internal and external customersDevelop tools to monitor, debug, analyze and operate our data infrastructureDesign and implement data technologies that can scale for hundreds of millions of usersCollaborate with our product and business teams to deliver valuable new features and functions Who you are: 2+ years of professional experience in data engineering environments2+ years of experience with SQL and programming in any of Python / Java / Scala or similar HLLExperience with data pipelines in Spark/Hive processing larger than 10TB of data is a plusExperience working in cloud environments, ideally with AWS/EMRStrong experience in improving performance of queries and data jobs and scaling the system for exponential growth in data volumes and trafficExpert debugging skills and enthusiasm for automation to deliver high-quality reliable systemsComfortable with modern development tools such as Git and Confluence and working in a distributed agile team environment with both high autonomy and regular collaborationBS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent experience What we offer: Incredible work environment, drawing from the best elements of the Barcelona and Bay Area tech scenesCompetitive salaryStock options after 1 year of employmentHealthy snacks, coffee and cool office space in the center of Barcelona near the subwayPrivate health insuranceEnglish/Spanish lessons and/or other investments in your professional developmentFlexible schedule based on trust and deliverables vs. hours behind your deskThe opportunity to shape the company culture of our Barcelona office and make it both Charboosty and unique More about us: We are proud of the product we've built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions and always design with the user in mind. Sounds like a fit? Join us, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming! We are an equal opportunity employer — we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and make our hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
Industries: Software, Marketing y publicidad, Videojuegos

Title: Data Engineer
Description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8DSK6BfnZ2E    Data Engineer We are looking for a data engineer with at least three year experience in data warehousing, and data-driven architectures to join our awesome development team and champion a healthy data culture spread all over the company.   The candidate will participate in the design, development, and testing of the company’s data warehouse solution, including data replication, distribution, high-availability, and data querying mechanisms – both for customer-facing services and internal tools. Being part of the development team, technology research and innovation will be a fundamental pillar in your activities.   The Data Engineer must have strong skills on data warehouse and data lakes components, including large-scale data streaming platforms, data modelling structures, raw data processing and querying mechanisms, data access optimization, and/or distributed data storage amongst others. Time series databases are a must within our systems.     What you will do…   Lead and participate in the design, development, and validation of the technical data warehousing solution for our internal systems – providing expert advice, making architectural considerations and employing best practices Design and implement the full data lifecycle, including data flows, and integrations between the different systems Write, optimize, and maintain scripts, API calls, and SQL-like queries (or similar querying languages) to gather and process raw data at scale Specify, design, and implement tailor-made ORMs, directly integrated into the company software platform Prepare, and maintain the data platform to feed into other systems, and automated reporting tools – generate automated reports Collaborate with the back-end team, and other departments to meet their data needs Write both technical and user documentation, and guarantee with the QA that data processes meet the quality standards   What we require from you…   At least 3 years of experience in a similar position Experience in data warehousing platforms and/or data lakes Experience in micro-service based architectures, large-scale distributed systems and data streaming architectures Deep knowledge of relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.) and non-relational databases, specifically time-series data bases (InfluxDB, or TimeScaleDB) and document-oriented databases Master in the art of writing SQL (or similar querying languages) queries, optimizing data operations’ response times and scalability Experience in any of the following programming languages: Python, Go, or Ruby-on-Rails Experience with Cloud-native technologies (docker, Kubernetes, etc.) and knowledge of Cloud Computing platforms (AWS, Private Cloud) Self-driven problem solver Capacity and willingness to learn new technologies Technology passionate and excellence seeker   What we would also like from you…   Data science skills for mid- and long-term analysis English written and spoken Experience working with Git, Gitlab, and Agile teams Linux shell scripting and server administration You have experience with Big Data tools (Hadoop, Storm, etc.) and other BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.) Coffee-lover and open-minded

Title: R&D Data Scientist
Description: Nommon’s Commercial Operations Are Organised Into Four Business Units  Nommon is a research-intensive technology company that provides information, quantitative analysis and decision support tools for the transportation market and other sectors where geospatial information plays a key role. Mobility Analytics, which analyses anonymised geolocation data from mobile devices to provide actionable information on people’s activity and mobility patterns.Transport & Mobility, which specialises in data-driven transport modelling and simulation.Aviation, which provides products and services for the planning and management of airports, airlines and air traffic management systems.Analytics Accelerator, which explores and develops opportunities in other verticals such as smart cities & urban planning, retail & geomarketing, and energy & environment.  Nommon’s Research Agenda Encompasses Three Main Threads  R&D activities are extremely important for Nommon as a source of knowledge, understanding of market opportunities, and ideas for innovative products and services. Big data processing and spatio-temporal data analysis.Complex systems modelling and data-driven simulation.Information visualisation and visual analytics.  Our R&D Department works closely with our business units in a cross-cutting role, developing new concepts and technological solutions and ensuring knowledge sharing within the company. As part of our expansion plans for 2021, we are looking for a Data Scientist (0-5 years of experience) to join our R&D Department in Madrid.  Job Description  You will work alongside an international, multidisciplinary team of talented researchers, product engineers, developers and consultants to develop innovative data analytics solutions and bring them to the market. Responsibilities include: Develop new methods, algorithms and tools for the integration, analysis and visualisation of spatio-temporal data originated from multiple distributed sources.Develop predictive models based on artificial intelligence and machine learning.Support Nommon’s business units in the definition and development of innovative products and services.Produce research papers and present Nommon’s research work at scientific conferences and internal seminars.  Required  Qualifications and skills MSc/PhD in a relevant scientific field, such as Engineering, Mathematics or Physics.Outstanding academic record.Strong mathematical and statistical background.Strong algorithmic, programming and computational problem solving skills.Marked taste for interdisciplinary work at the intersection of engineering and the social sciences.Excellent English and Spanish oral and written communication skills. Nice to have, but not indispensable Experience/knowledge in geospatial data analysis Experience/knowledge in machine learning.Experience/knowledge in optimisation and operational research.Experience/knowledge in development and/or use of computational simulation tools.Experience/knowledge in programming in C, C++, Python, R, Matlab or Java. Salary and benefits Annual salary: 32.000 – 42.000 €.Long term and stable position.Regular performance and salary reviews.Nice, well-located office in the centre of Madrid.Flexible working hours and possibility for occasional home-office. How to apply  To apply for this position, please email your CV and a copy of your academic transcript along with a covering letter in a single document to rrhh@nommon.es with the subject line ‘Job Application 2020-10 R&D Data Scientist’.  We always reach out to all applicants, so wait for our call or e-mail over the next few days after your application is submitted.
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Investigación

Title: Data Scientist (ML)
Description: At seedtag our mission is to change how online advertising is done. Our technology joins some of the largest online websites with the world’s best known brands to create a new way of advertising that is more effective and provides a better user experience for hundreds of millions of users every day.  Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, today we proudly count over 130 employees in 8 countries. As we continue our fast paced growth, we are looking for the best data scientist to help us develop our technology and help us change the world of digital advertising together. Our team faces massive scalability challenges to be able to process millions of requests per minute with very strict timing requirements. Through the use of machine learning algorithms we analyse the content of every page and achieve human-like content understanding to provide the best possible ad contextualization in the industry.  As a member of the Data Science team you will contribute to all the ML efforts of the company. You will work on improving our contextualization technology, which analyzes and understands the content of every webpage to create a perfect match between the content and our ads. You will help us develop language-dependent knowledge and find training examples to further develop the quality of our system.  Your responsibilities you will work on improving our natural language processing systems, expanding it’s comprehension capabilities you will help us develop our brand safety technology, which analyzes articles to ensure that ads are always displayed in a positive context you will work on the optimization of our real-time price engine to maximize the profit for our publishers  About you you have at least 4 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning you have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component you understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems you have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, etc. you are a proactive person who likes the startup work culture  What we offer you a fun, dynamic and international work environment a competitive salary adjusted to your experience access to a flexible benefits plan (plan de retribución flexible) a Macbook Pro with an external screen a great work location in the heart of Madrid (Gran Via)and the possibility to work remotely the option to work from home/telework and real flexible working hours the option to follow company-paid English and/or Spanish courses weekly the chance to participate in many offsite activities and have lots of fun with your colleagues!   Interested?  Then apply through our Website
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Medios de comunicación en línea, Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Adidea es una boutique de headhunting en España. Somos especialistas en la búsqueda de talento humano para empresas, asegurándonos siempre del match perfecto entre cada posición y cada candidato.  Nuestro cliente, una multinacional del sector reatil (deporte) selecciona un  Data Scientist  para formar parte del departamento de Soluciones & Tecnología, en el equipo de Datos e IA.   Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades    Pondrás tus conocimientos de Data Science e IA al servicio de las personas, para mejorar su experiencia o para simplificar su trabajo.  Serás la (el) responsable de diseñar y desarrollar soluciones de Machine Learning e IA para ser explotadas en sistemas de acceso masivo y alta escalabilidad : Soluciones de optimización de omnicomercio , predicciones climáticas, sistemas de personalización y recomendación , asistentes de toma de decisión comerciales.  Vigilarás los avances tecnológicos en el mercado y propondrás nuevas soluciones donde identifiques una oportunidad para el negocio.  Parte de tu cometido es participar en la creación de un framework para el desarrollo de proyectos de Machine Learning e IA junto al resto del equipo, de transferir la competencia y mentorizar a otras personas del equipo en relación a las técnicas y sus aplicaciones de Machine Learning e IA .    Lo que te pedimos    Fuertes principios de desarrollo, repositorios y flujo de desarrollo.  Fluidez en lenguajes como R y Python.  Te desenvuelves muy bien en Jupyter y RStudio.  Eres Data Story Maker: te desenvuelves bien explicando los conceptos de Machine Learning y Data Science para hacerlos comprensible para stakeholders y usuarios.  Fuerte experiencia con SQL y en la manipulación de juegos de datos masivos, especialmente Bigquery y Redshift.  Experiencia en el modelado de sistemas descriptivos y predictivos.  Amplio conocimiento en técnicas de Machine Learning y experiencia en construcción de soluciones basadas en Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Tensorflow / Keras.  Experiencia en el desarrollo de sistemas de visualización de datos, programáticamente (p.ej. Matplotlib, Plotly, R Shiny, ggplot2), o con herramientas especializadas en reporting o exploración (Data Studio, Apache Superset,..).  Muy buen nivel de Inglés, hablado y escrito  Lo que te ofrecemos    Contrato indefinido.  Salario base + variables.  Gimnasio gratuito en las oficinas.  Beneficios sociales.  Flexibilidad horaria.  Formación según una trayectoria que tú construirás, en un entorno que te invitara a tomar decisiones a diario y donde todos consideran que equivocarse también forma parte del proceso.  Entorno de trabajo muy poco jerarquizado donde la toma de decisión está muy distribuida y que favorece la promoción interna.  Libertad y responsabilidad.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Internet, Recursos humanos

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Volotea is the newest and fastest-growing low-cost airline in Europe, focused on connecting medium and small-sized European cities. We launched in April 2012 and currently we have 1500 employees in High season.  Our headquarters are located in Barcelona, Spain. Our principal markets are France, Italy, Greece, Germany and Spain. We have 16 operational bases: Nantes, Bordeaux, Toulouse, Marseille, Strasbourg and Lyon in France: Venice, Verona, Palermo, Genoa, Cagliari and Naples in Italy: Athens in Greece: Hamburg in Germany and Asturias and Bilbao in Spain. We have transported more than 25 million passengers in over eight years of operation, with a modern fleet, which is currently made of Airbus 319 and Boeing 717.  We are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data Science team in Barcelona Headquarters.  We are looking for a proactive, analytical, passionate and yet very responsible and rigorous person who is used to interact in different cultural environments, and wants to work in a challenging high-growth environment.  Roles And Responsibilities  Help other departments in the company (i.e. Revenue, Operations, Strategy, Client, Finance…) to enhance their business by building and maintaining data driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms and constraint models. Combine independent problem-solving tasks with proactive integration in a highly dynamic team.Play with different data sources to identify, define and develop new process optimization strategies.Maintain, update and improve existing algorithms.Explore current industry trends and recent academic research to update and enhance the in-house workflows.  Required Skills Degree in analytical field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or other technical field).At least one year of experience in data mining, statistics, machine learning techniques and/or econometrics. Programing skills with Phyton.Knowledge of SQL.Ability to think analytically, quantitatively and creatively.Good Communications skills. Advanced level of Spanish and English. 2 years of expierience  Highly Valued Skills Master Degree in Data Science, AI, Applied Maths, Applied Statistics, Machine Learning or similar.Knowledge in specific SQL DB Systems such as Sybase, MySQL, ORACLE, SQL Server.Knowledge in cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform.Exposure to Big data technologies such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Spark or Impala.Able to work in a fast-paced environment on multiple tasks and problems.
