Title: UX Researcher
Description: About Glovo  We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.  Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.  Your Work-life Opportunity  As a UX Researcher at Glovo, you will help provide actionable and meaningful data-driven insights that represent the voice of our users. You will collaborate across multiple teams to evaluate current and upcoming user research needs that will help to improve our product definition and drive our business goals, assessing opportunities for Glovo to innovate.  Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will  Conduct user research across 4 mobile and web products to help better understand customer expectations, needs and motivations  Work closely with product teams, as well as other researchers, to identify important research questions  Work cross-functionally with many stakeholders including product management, data science, design, engineering, and marketing  Design and execute studies that address both user behaviour and attitudes, using the right methodology for the right questions  Synthesise qualitative and mixed methods – like interviews, surveys, online platform tools, focus groups, review analysis, ethnographic studies – into well-founded conclusions and proposals  Generate insights that both fuel ideas and evaluate designs  Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful questions  Communicate and document findings and recommendations, either written or in presentation style, to peers and stakeholders    You Have  Bachelor’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, or Social Science  3 or more years of experience with research applied to mobile and web products  Excellent spoken and written English and Spanish  Knowledge of qualitative, quantitative and user-centered design methods  Ability to define key research questions and objectives, identify appropriate methods, execute studies, and synthesise findings  Someone who is flexible, proactive and resourceful. Glovo aims to be a design leader in a highly competitive market    Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits  Enticing Phantom Shares plan  Attractive Relocation package (if applicable :))  Comprehensive Private Health Insurance  Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food  Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)  Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!  Discounted Gym memberships  Flexible working environment    What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo  Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.  Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.  Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.  Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.  Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.   If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!  Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.  For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Title: Senior IT Consultant Data Scientist
Description: Inetum Alicante is seeking Senior IT Consultant Data Scientist profile for working in a International enviroment in Alicante. Inetum is an agile IT services company that provides digital services and solutions, and a global group that helps companies and institutions to get the most out of digital flow. In a context of perpetual movement, where needs and usages are constantly being reinvented, the Inetum group is committed towards all these players to innovate, continue to adapt, and stay ahead. With its multi-expert profile, Inetum offers its clients a unique combination of proximity, a sectorial organisation, and solutions of industrial quality. Operating in more than 26 countries, the Group has nearly 27,000 employees and in 2019 generated revenues of €2.3 billion (pro forma).  Nature of the tasks Responsible for the design and implementation of big data solutions based on new technologies and platforms for complex business problems. The big data architect should possess the skills to combine the capabilities of heterogeneous data platforms and sources of all types of data (structured, unstructured or semi-structured), and define the standards and policies for the management of this data, and its dissemination to different actors. Should possess practical experience with data extraction and processing pipelines (including real-time or stream-processing platforms) and demonstrated experience in systems, frameworks and tools related to data analytics and reporting. Title: Consultoría | Ingeniero DevOps // Hub Málaga
Description: Line of Service Advisory  Industry/Sector Not Applicable  Specialism Managed Services  Management Level Senior Associate  Job Description & Summary A career within Data and Analytics Technology services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations uncover enterprise insights and drive business results using smarter data analytics. We focus on a collection of organisational technology capabilities, including business intelligence, data management, and data assurance that help our clients drive innovation, growth, and change within their organisations in order to keep up with the changing nature of customers and technology. We make impactful decisions by mixing mind and machine to leverage data, understand and navigate risk, and help our clients gain a competitive edge.  PwC, firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio.  La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Analytics y Business Security Solutions.    El equipo de Data Analytics cuenta con profesionales con más de 10 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de analítica avanzada y su aplicación a entornos productivos. También se cuenta con una plataforma propia de big data desarrollada con los componentes más actuales a nivel tecnológico que permite un rápido y eficiente desarrollo de modelos analíticos.    En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics profesionales con perfil de Devops para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado.    Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PWC en Málaga. Este Hub es el Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics de PWC en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo.     Requisitos    Grado o Ingeniería en Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas, Física, Estadística    Formación (máster, postgrado) en Cloud computing o Big Data   4-6 años de experiencia en administración de plataformas cloud, preferiblemente con plataforma, aunque también valorable Amazon AWS, Google Cloud...)  Administración de sistemas: Preferiblemente Linux  Automatización de procesos  Scripting con Python, Powershell, Shell script, …  Integración de sistemas  Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server…)  Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua  Sistema de control de versiones Git.  Metodologías ágiles  Deseable conocimiento de tecnología Apache Spark y Hadoop  Nivel alto de inglés   Valorable certificaciónes: Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions y/o Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions      Education  (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)  Degrees/Field of Study required:Degrees/Field of Study preferred:   Certifications  (if blank, certifications not specified)     Desired Languages  (If blank, desired languages not specified)    Travel Requirements 0%  Available for Work Visa Sponsorship? Yes  Government Clearance Required? No  Job Posting End Date

Title: Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Network Biology)
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Network Biology) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To Devise network approaches to gain insights from large-scale datasets of molecular profiles of cancer and other disease areas. These profiles include genomic and transcriptomic data, but also involve epigenetic regulation, phenotypic (CRISPR) screens and single-cell measurementsDevelop innovative computational tools and methods to elucidate mechanisms of disease and predict model the effects of (combinations of) treatmentsCollaboratively apply these methods to impact the clinical development of pipeline compounds and the discovery of novel therapies  Requirements PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).Advanced mathematical and statistical skills. Machine learning expertise a plus.Familiarity with methods for high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etcExperience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageousAttention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.Verbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Recursos humanos, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria

Title: SCADA Technical Commissioner
Description: GreenPowerMonitor offers products and services in the renewable energy sector, with a specific focus in the photovoltaic space. With more than 10 years’ experience, company has consolidated its position as the independent leader in management, monitoring and control of renewable energy installations with more than 32 GW globally managed and more than 4,000 solar facilities worldwide.  GreenPowerMonitor has a great depth of experience with renewable energy plants across the globe and delivers a market-leading integrated solution set for the management and maintenance of green energy installations that includes Hardware, Software and Services unmatched in the industry.  GreenPowerMonitor merged forces with DNV GL to make world safer, smarter, greener.  Learn more at www.greenpowermonitor.com and www.dnvgl.com .  The position is a part of Data Acquisition and Project Management Unit .  The main areas of this unit include:  Technical support to the costumers (technical questions and technical issues solving) and Country Managers / Sales managers (offers reviewing and solving technical doubts)Be part of the Project team creating single-line drawings, engineering the solution, device testing, programming devices and HW. Perform Local and remote commissioning of Renewable Plants.   If you want to be involved in big data projects, learn from and work with a skilled team. If you want to call Barcelona “home”, but work with wind and PV farms across the world . Want to apply your skills as developer by running complex projects and are excited to work for a company whose technical expertise spans the energy industry. You can find it with us.  If you are a trained engineer or scientist with a keen eye for detail and a sense of urgency to effectively communicate what you see and what options you propose to move forward. You never compromise on safety, quality or integrity. You thrive in a dynamic environment being flexible and adaptable to deliver timely results to our clients, building their trust and confidence to ensure continued relationships. Join our team!   Position Qualifications   Required Skills and Qualifications:  Engineering degree (Telecommunications, Computer Science, Electronics, Electric or similar)It is essential to have absolute availability to travel. Working out of the office around 80% of the time since the facilities are usually abroad.   Desired skills:  Experience with industrial communication equipment and protocols (Modbus, DNP3 etc.)Experience within the renewable energy industry or renewable energy taught course modules, including knowledge of how wind and photovoltaic plants workExperience in configuration and troubleshooting of local networks and toolsWorking experience with LinuxNetworks knowledgeExperience in security assessmentGood communication skills, including the ability to write clear and accurate reports in EnglishEnthusiasm and self-motivation, including a willingness to develop and enjoy taking challenges and responsibilitiesCustomer centricity and business development experience  We offer:  Medical SchemeCommuting AllowanceMeal Ticket or Meal allowanceLife InsurancePension PlanKindergarten Allowance40 Hours per week with Flexible Schedule  Please submit your CV in English.   Company & Business Area Description   DNV GL is a global quality assurance and risk management company. Driven by our purpose of safeguarding life, property and the environment, we enable our customers to advance the safety and sustainability of their business. Operating in more than 100 countries, our professionals are dedicated to helping customers in the maritime, oil & gas, power and renewables and other industries to make the world safer, smarter and greener.  Equal Opportunity Statement    DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!
Industries: Energía renovable y medio ambiente, Protección civil, Petróleo y energía

Title: Network Researcher
Description: i2Cat Foundation  's Scientific group, managed by an ICREA/i2CAT Research Professor, is looking for two talented  researchers  with a strong background in the field of  mobile networks  and experience in applied  AI  . The Scientific group is focused on basic and fundamental R&D activities on new challenging concepts, such as network/RAN virtualization, network programmability, network slicing, mmwave, smart surfaces, etc. with a particular interest on their applications towards the society digital transformation. Expected 6G use cases, such as AI-based automation of mobile networks, mission-critical communications and wireless sensing, will be carefully evaluated and corresponding solutions will be designed and implemented in our lab premises.  The work focuses on the analytical evaluation of solutions designed as well as proof of concepts both for public and industrial R&D projects in collaboration with industrial and academic partners.  Work objectives are concept studies and evaluation, research prototype software development, publications as well as IPR creation. The research work will be carried out in an international team of researchers.  Who We Are  i2CAT Foundation is a non-profit research and innovation centre that promotes mission oriented R&D activities on advanced Internet architectures, applications and services. The centre stands for a new open innovation framework, fostering the collaboration between companies, public administration, the academic environment and end-users.  i2CAT’s activities span the areas of Research, playing a key role in the EU Framework Program for Research and Innovation: Strategic Projects, leading local initiatives that strengthen the digital policies of public administration, and Technology Transfer, fostering R&D collaboration with companies to develop innovative market-oriented solutions.  Want to know more? Visit our webpage !  What Do We Offer  You will be part of a multicultural team. We have a fun loving and friendly international work environment.  Be in contact and work with cutting-edge technology  Work in challenging R&D projects  A full-time fixed term, of initial duration of 3 years. The contract may be extended till the end of the project  Fix + variable salary  Option of flexible retribution (restaurant card, transport card, medical insurance, kindergarten) Flexible working schedule - We know you have a life outside of work and we will work with you to make sure it's kept that way  Fridays afternoon off  Intensive work schedule in July & August  Home-office option  Open space office in Barcelona  Free fruit every week  Discounted Gym-access 25 vacation days per year  Casual dress code  Let us know which trainings you need  You will have the opportunity to attend tech conferences and events.  The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and, therefore explicitly, encourages women to apply.  The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of persons with disabilities among its workforce, and therefore explicitly encourages this collective to apply.  Applications Should Include  Cover letter stating the motivation and suitability of the candidate   Minimum Requirements  PhD degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science  Research publications in top venues  Excellent academic record 5G network architecture and protocols  Artificial Intelligence basics  Data Science basics  Network virtualization concepts  Network programmability  Operational networks traces analysis  Network optimization models  Prototyping for PoC demonstrations  Software development under UNIX-based system (Linux, FreeBSD etc.)  Desired Requirements  Participation in EU funded research projects  International experience as a postdoc researcher  Experience with AI frameworks, e.g. pytorch ...  Practical experience with commercial network equipment  Access points, base stations, switches, EPC, ...  Software-defined Radio (SDR) such as FPGA (e.g., NI USRP), mmwave COTS  mmwave networks  Wireless Sensing  IPR generation experience- Teaching
Industries: Internet, Recursos humanos, Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones

Company Name: Institut Català de Nanociència i Nanotecnologia (ICN2)
Title: Postdoctoral Researcher - Phononic and Photonic Nanostructures Group
Description: Offer Description  Description of Group/Project:  Topological bosonics: design and optimization of topological materials  In January 2019 we started a 5-year EU FET-Proactive project on Topological matter in collaboration with the group of Quantum Photonics at the Niels Bohr Institute in Copenhagen and groups working on electronic topological insulators such as the Physics and Engineering of Nanodevices group at ICN2 and the group of Topological Insulators at Würzburg University. Our main goal is to gain a radically new fundamental knowledge of the interactions and correlations between topological excitations (photons, phonons and electrons) in hybrid topological systems for efficient transfer and manipulation of classical and quantum information by a suitable combination of specific materials and structures, e.g. topological insulators and photonic crystals, and by designing device-like structures that host more than one topological quasiparticle
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Enseñanza superior, Investigación, Biotecnología

Title: Data Engineer
Description: About Glovo  We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.  Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.  Your Work-life Opportunity  We are looking for talented and passionate Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team in our Barcelona HQ.  Glovo has a culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands data that is timely, accurate, and actionable. We grow really fast collecting Terabytes of data from tens of data sources and providing interfaces for our internal customers to access and query the data hundreds of thousands of times per day.  As a Data Engineer you will be building and constantly improving Glovo’s reliable and scalable Big Data Platform using technologies like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Spark, Python and many more. Joining us your work will have an immediate influence on the shape of data consumed by teams across Glovo including Central BI, Data Scientists and Business Analysts.  Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for itself having helped deliver on data platform wide projects that have had significant impact. You have developed complex, scalable and well designed data pipelines and defined engineering standards which have helped different data teams achieve efficiency while providing mentoring and technical leadership where necessary. You will be at times working independently and at other times within a team to achieve a given goal. Others respect you and you are a sought out Data Engineer because of your expertise and depth of knowledge.  Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will  Design, implement and keep improving Glovo Data Platform  Build scalable data pipelines using different technologies  Participate in the development of Data Lake, Data Warehouse, different methods of data ingestion and Self Service ETL tools using best architectural practices.  Mentor & share technical expertise with data engineers, data scientists, BI analysts and other technology colleagues  Be on top of new technologies and industry trends    You Have  At least 3+ years of software/data engineering experience  At least 2+ years experience in Python and Spark  Professional experience building complex ETLs/data pipelines  Working experience with Amazon Web Services / Google Cloud Platform  Experience with task orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi)  Cloud Data Warehousing experience in Redshift or another distributed platform (e.g. Hadoop + Hive/Presto, BigQuery or Snowflake)  Experience in Data Streaming (Spark, Flume, Kafka, Kinesis, Flink, etc.)  Import and transform data from many third-party APIs  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Very good English    Nice To Have  Experience working with AWS EMR, AWS Glue, Databricks  Experience with Docker, Kubernetes  Experience in building Data Lake  Orchestration of Machine Learning pipelines    Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits  Enticing Phantom Shares plan  Attractive Relocation package  Comprehensive Private Health Insurance  Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food  Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)  Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!  Discounted Gym memberships  Flexible working environment    What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo  Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.  Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future. Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.  Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.  Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.   If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!  Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.  For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Software, Internet

With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.  Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves! Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.  Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.  Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.  Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.   If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!  At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.  Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!  Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Title: Data Engineer Madrid
Description: About Accenture  Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.  We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.  With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.  Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.  About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence  Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.  The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.  Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.  Data Engineer role  Introduction  You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.  Your role    To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions   Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise   Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution   Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations   Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.   A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks  Key Responsibilities   Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.   Design the integration with legacy data sources.   Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.   Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.   Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.   Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.   Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality   Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals   Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts  Skills You Will Need   Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP. Title: Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Integrative Multi-Omics)
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Science (Integrative Multi-Omics) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To Develop and apply computational strategies to mine large-scale collections of molecular data of cancer and other disease areas, such as (single-cell) transcriptomic and (epi)genomic dataImplement and critically evaluate novel methods, using e.g. deep learning, to represent and extract features from multi-dimensional, high-content dataDevelop integrative methods for multi-layered single-cell measurementsBuild robust and efficient solutions using on-site or cloud-based infrastructureCollaborate with computational and experimental scientists to derive and validate insights of therapeutic relevance  Requirements PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publicationsExperience analyzing omics and single-cell dataStrong grasp of scientific programming languages (e.g. Python, R) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. TensorFlow).Strong technical and theoretical foundation in computational methodsDemonstrated ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to audiences with diverse scientific backgroundsPrevious experience using cloud-based computing and software engineering frameworks (e.g. Docker, Git). Experience with GPU programming a plusVerbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Recursos humanos, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria

Title: Head of Data Science & Analytics
Description: About Typeform  One sunny Barcelona morning, two designers sat down to build a beautiful lead gen form for a bathroom company’s showroom. They ended up reimagining the data collection experience, and realized it was one idea they wouldn’t be flushing down the toilet. Today, Typeform is a team of over 300 people from more than 35 countries, with offices in Barcelona, Spain and San Francisco, US.  We’re building a world where brands, businesses, and their communities can have more personal relationships with the people who matter most. To do this, we give people the tools they need to have conversational experiences at scale—because meaningful relationships start with conversations.  From online lead forms and engaging quizzes, to face-to-face encounters in the office, help us build more meaningful relationships, one conversation at a time.  About The Team  You will be joining the Insights and Analytics team which is a diverse and passionate group of Researchers, Data Visualization Experts, Data Warehouse Architects and, of course, Data Scientists. We work embedded throughout the organization with the goal of being as close to decisions as possible.  About The Role   As Head of Data Science & Analytics Chapter you will be responsible for developing, managing, and empowering a team of 6-8 data scientists. You will drive Product/Marketing growth by identifying and delivering on strategic data initiatives through your team. You will also lead and own key data department initiatives outside of your chapter.   Here’s What You’ll Do   Create the right environment and rituals to keep the team engaged and aiming to improve themselves quarter over quarter   Provide timely feedback and mentoring so that the individuals can continuously grow, make their biggest impact and thrive on their day to day job   Keep the team motivated, setting ambitious goals and with a sense of pride over their achievements   Actively participate in the hiring process, by bringing to the team the best talent in terms of diverse critical thinking, technical skills & culture   Translate specific questions into broader business problems. Assist the team in scoping and delivering impactful complex projects   Be passionately curious about Typeform customer's behaviors and raise questions for the team and the organization to challenge the status quo and generate new insights   Drive Product/Marketing organization to adopt data-driven frameworks and data solutions that will allow them to accelerate growth & improve performance   Contribute to Data Team Management & Excellence by proactively proposing processes to help the whole Data team work more seamlessly and efficiently in the operational day-to-day   Together with other Data leaders contribute to defining career frameworks    Here’s What We’re After  About you   You’ve got 7+ years of experience as a data scientist and developed domain knowledge while working closely with a Product or Marketing teams   You have enjoyed leading a team of DS for more than 2 years   You're empathic, enthusiastic, and collaborative   You have a proven track record of statistical modeling / applied machine learning with a focus on churn prediction, LTV prediction, and customer behavioral clustering   You have experience with A/B and Multivariate test design and implementation   You’re pragmatic. You value simple and effective solutions over complicated brain-melters   You can take a complex concept and make it sound simple, using clear visual references to help   You like taking on big challenges—given the appropriate time and resources   You’re hungry to learn and embrace healthy debate   You are proficient in building queries with SQL   You have experience with AWS or other cloud systems   You are an expert in Python or R, and have some experience in implementation (Scala/Java)   You’re fluent in English and eager to work in a multicultural, international environment    It'd Be Amazing If You Also Have   Knowledge of Big Data technologies (e.g. Spark or Redshift)   Think you’re a good fit? Hit apply—success might be just around the corner 😉  Today, more than 2.5M people from all over the world use Typeform. We celebrate the diversity of our customer base, and we want our employees to reflect those differences. At Typeform, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Software, Internet

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - Madrid
Description: DescripciónParticipar en el desarrollo de modelos analíticos para resolver problemas de negocio y facilitar la extracción de. conclusiones sobre los datos.Participar en la definición de requerimientos a partir de las historias de usuario enviadas por las áreas de negocio para ser desarrolladas por el CoE y participar en la documentación de los proyectos que sean llevados a cabo por el CoE.Colaborar en el análisis de técnicas y casos de uso existentes en el mercado en lo referente a modelos analíticos de datos para identificar aquellas cuya aplicación pudiera ser útil para el CoE Analytics.Desarrollar algoritmos usando estadística y matemáticas para ejecutar funciones analíticas que sean requeridas por las áreas usuarias del CoE. Así como aplicación de algoritmos de Deep Learning para realizar los proyectos de analítica avanzadade la compañía.Preparación y análisis de datos estructurados y no estructurados, para extraer conocimiento que pueda aprovecharse para el desarrollo de soluciones.Revisar los datos empleando métodos estadísticos de cara a descubrir anomalías y contradicciones, monitorizar el rendimiento y la efectividad de los modelos implementados y aportar análisis que faciliten la toma de decisiones a las distintas Áreas de Negocio de la compañía. ¿Qué buscamos?
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Recursos humanos, Seguros

Title: Senior Data Science
Description: everis es una consultora global dinámica, creciente y ambiciosa. Empleamos a más de 21.000 personas en todo el mundo y hemos alcanzado un crecimiento anual promedio del 20%. Somos parte de NTT Data, una empresa que emplea a más de 100.000 profesionales con una facturación superior a los 15 mil millones de euros. Desde el área de Business Consulting  Barcelona estamos buscando a personas con ganas de aprender y de afrontar nuevos retos. Trabajamos con clientes de diferentes sectores (como Banca, Seguros, Gran Consumo, Industria, Sector Público, Utilities) impulsándoles a transformar sus negocios y optimizando su operativa diaria.  everis desea contratar un/a senior data scientist en  el departamento de business analytics que sea capaz de obtener conclusiones de negocio a partir de grandes volúmenes de información mediante la realización de análisis estadísticos y modelos de machine learning.     Titulación: Formación en Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, o formación técnica (Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería Telecomunicaciones…). Se valorarán Postgrados en Inteligencia Artificial, Data Science, Big Data, etc.   Experiencia: de 3 a 6 años en Business Analytics, Data Science, Advanced Analytics   Tareas a realizar: Toma de requerimientos de usuarios de negocio para el diseño de los modelos de analítica avanzada. Análisis de fuentes de información con las áreas de tecnología y negocio. Elaboración y validación de estudios y análisis orientados a la obtención de conclusiones de negocio. Análisis de datos mediante estadística descriptiva y exploratoria. Análisis teórico/práctico de técnicas de Machine Learning y modelación para predicción y optimización y su posterior aplicación a la resolución de problemas reales. Desarrollo de nuevos algoritmos que permitan alcanzar los objetivos y mejorar los resultados existentes, aplicando técnicas de modelación y Machine Learning. Gestión de las relaciones multidisciplinares: de negocio, tecnología, proveedores. Coordinación de pequeños equipos de proyecto. Relación con cliente. Apoyo en la actividad comercial del área.   Conocimientos: Requerido: Demostración de ejecución de proyectos analíticos Manejo de técnicas de estadística descriptiva y exploratoria Expertise profundo en técnicas estadísticas, de modelación y de Machine Learning Modelos estadísticos y matemáticos, y técnicas de Machine Learning: redes neuronales, Random Forest, SVM, algoritmos evolutivos, series temporales, modelos y redes bayesianas, segmentación, etc Manejo de técnicas y modelos de Text Mining: análisis exploratorio de textos (wordcloud, redes semánticas,…), construcción de diccionarios, detección de topics, clasificación automática de textos, detección de entidades, sentiment analysis, emotion recognition. Conocimiento experto de al menos un lenguaje Python o R SQL y BBDD relacional y no relacional Gestión de proyectos y equipos Manejo avanzado de Power Point y Excel Valorado: Tecnologías Big Data: Spark, Hive, h2o, etc. Text Mining, NLP, Deep Learning, Process Mining, Optimización Metodologías para la ejecución de proyectos de Data Science Expertise en plataformas de data science (RapidMiner, KNIME, Dataiku, etc.) Manejo de entornos cloud AWS y Azure   En everis creemos que toda persona es única y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.  Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.  #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: Data Engineer Barcelona
Description: About Accenture  Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.  We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.  With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.  Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.  About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence  Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.  The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.  Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.  Data Engineer role  Introduction  You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.  Your role    To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions   Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise   Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution   Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations   Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.   A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks  Key Responsibilities   Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.   Design the integration with legacy data sources.   Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.   Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.   Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.   Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.   Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality   Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals   Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts  Skills You Will Need   Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP.   SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL   NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB   Other database tools, e.g. SCADA   Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS   Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred)   Unix and Unix-like systems   Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud   Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio   Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA. Title: ROBOTICS RESEARCHER (COMPUTER VISION AND DEEP LEARNING)
Description: Eurecat Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña  CATALÀ Eurecat, Centre Tecnològic de Catalunya (membre de Tecnio), aplega l’experiència de més de 650 professionals i dóna servei a més de 1.700 empreses. R+D aplicat, més de 200 projectes realitzats, serveis tecnològics, formació d’alta especialització, consultoria tecnològica, 88 patents, 7 spin-ofss i esdeveniments professionals són alguns dels serveis que Eurecat ofereix tant per a grans com per a petites i mitjanes empreses de tots els sectors. El valor afegit que aporta Eurecat accelera la innovació, disminueix la despesa en infraestructures científiques i tecnològiques, redueix els riscos i proporciona coneixement especialitzat a mida de cada empresa. CASTELLANO Eurecat, Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña (miembro de Tecnio), aglutina la experiencia de más de 650 profesionales y presta servicio a más de 1.700 empresas. I+D aplicado, más de 200 proyectos realizados, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica, 88 patentes, 7 spin-off y eventos profesionales son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa. ENGLISH Eurecat, Technology Centre of Catalonia (member of Tecnio), brings together the expertise of 650 professionals and serving more than a 1.700 companies. Applied R + D, more than 200 projects, technological services, highly specialized training, 88 patents, 7 spin-offs, technology consulting and professional events are some of the services that Eurecat offers for both small and medium-sized companies of all sectors. The added value provided by Eurecat accelerates innovation, decreases spending on scientific and technological infrastructures, reduces risks and provides specialized knowledge to each company.  Job Description  Job Description  The Robotics and Automation Unit of Eurecat Technology Center (Barcelona) is looking for a highly motivated researcher to work on Computer Vision and Deep Learning for industrial robotics and human-robot interaction.  The candidate shall work on different research projects dealing with robotic systems and sensors (mostly cameras). The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments in the Robotics Unit with a special focus on Computer Vision and Deep Learning as well as reports and project proposal elaboration. Other specializations will be considered depending on the applicant background and experience. The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments in the perception line. Examples could be object detection and classification, relative pose estimation, perception on deformable objects, human tracking, etc.  What Eurecat Can Offer You  The Robotics Group is specialized in research and development on Ground, Aerial and Industrial Robotics. With a strong focus on our customers and partners needs, our mission is to enhance the capabilities and reliability of autonomous systems operating in realistic scenarios, improving the existing technology and enabling new applications. For over 10 years, the group has been involved in several of the most successful European projects in robotics. These are the links of our current and previous publicly available robotics projects:  Check Others In  Our laboratory is located in Cerdanyola del Vallès, in the outskirts of Barcelona city (Spain). Barcelona besides being easily connected to the rest of Europe, provides a great quality of life and a great robotics ecosystem full of initiatives, research groups, robotics companies and interesting events. And many more to come!  Requirements  Required skills MSc or PhD in Robotics/Computer Vision or related disciplineProven experience in Computer Vision and Deep Learning.Advanced experience with C++, reusable code and software documentation.Team spirit and ability to work independently.Excellent communication skills, flexibility and creativity.Very good knowledge of English is required.  Additional Requirements Familiarity with cameras and perception sensors.Experience with robotic hardware and electronics.Knowledge about ROS (Robot Operating System)Availability to travel occasionallyAvailability to work in client facilities temporallyJob: ResearcherDepartment: Robotics & AutomationLocation: Cerdanyola del Vallès (Spain)Contract: PermanentWorking day: Full timeSector: OtherVacancies: 1Discipline: R&D

Title: Senior UX Researcher
Description: Description  At Amazon, we strive to be Earth’s most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. Amazon’s evolution from website to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of our DNA. We hire the world’s brightest minds, offering them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for customers. We do this every day by solving complex, technical and business problems with ingenuity and simplicity.  Amazon's Customer Service (CS) department is looking for a talented and passionate Sr UX researcher to join the CS team. This researcher will have a significant impact on our business as they lead research efforts for Amazon Customer Service products and services. The individual will perform competitive analyses and research, measure Amazon’s end-to-end CS experience, propose and deliver significant areas for improvement to Amazon’s CS program teams and product stakeholders.  Responsibilities  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  Work closely with product, design, and business partners to identify and prioritize research opportunities based on need and impact Translate product and design goals into research questions and plans Determine and apply proper research methods to the type of questions being answered Write research proposals including requested budgets as needed Evangelize UX research and advocate for the user and be able to clearly explain research findings and make thoughtful recommendations to the organization that align with both user and business goals Own long-term vision and strategy for the UX research team Manage UX research team and vendors, mentor peer researchers Plan, gather and analyze insights about our users through new studies and review of existing data Skills & Qualifications  A degree in Anthropology, Human Factors, Psychology, HCI/Computer Science or other related fields 5+ years of hands-on experience conducting applied UX research in an industry setting 3+ years of experience successfully managing UX teams and/or mentoring peer researchers End-to-end experience conducting all aspects of research (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting) Preferred Qualifications  Experience managing small teams is a plus 7+ years of relevant work experience, including experience leading and integrating user research into product designs and design practices Experience with international research Internet, e-commerce research experience Demonstrated success influencing product and design decisions with research insights Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skill Fluent in another European languge (other than English) e.g. German, French, Italian, Spanish  Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L. Job ID: A1276307

Title: Postdoctoral researcher
Description: Offer Description  Applications are invited for a full-time postdoctoral research position in the Neurotwin project, aimed at developing and experimentally validating local and whole-brain models to design new personalized neuromodulation protocols for the treatment of neurological disorders. The successful candidate will join the Dynamical Systems Biology lab ( ) led by Prof. Jordi Garcia-Ojalvo, in the Department of Experimental and Health Sciences of the Universitat Pompeu Fabra ( ). Candidates with physics and/or computational neuroscience backgrounds are encouraged to apply.  We seek candidates with solid demonstrable experience in the application of statistical physics to neuroscience, and/or on the computational modelling of local and whole-brain network dynamics. Expertise in the analysis of neuroimaging data with statistical learning methods will be positively considered.
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Enseñanza superior, Investigación, Biotecnología

Title: Temporary part time researcher - CATCAR
Description: Offer Description  “CATCAR: Patrimonio digital al servicio de la innovación social” is a cross-border cooperation project, innovating in the field of intangible heritage. The aim of the programme is to make the Carolingian world (8th-10th centuries) accessible to all thanks to new technologies: multimedia content, digital cartography, gamification tools and other augmented reality artefacts. This historical period prefigured the construction of the current European Union.  Catalonia has one of the richest documentary collections in Europe for this period. CATCAR will create a virtual platform of open access and other digital innovation products that will make it possible to recreate the society and landscape of Carolingian Catalonia.  The selected candidate will become part of a multidisciplinary team of 16 people from different Universities and public and private institutions. You can find more information on the project and their activities here .  This offer requires working on the project together with the team of UB members and attending follow-up meetings.  From a technical point of view, the applicant must have extensive experience in medieval Latin and in the reading and correct interpretation of medieval documents, as well as the necessary knowledge to understand and relate all the elements of an economic, fiscal, and monetary nature that appear in the documents from the Carolingian period. The applicant must also have the capacity to extract from the documents all the data that might be used in gamification actions.  Knowledge of the historical period of Carolingian Catalonia (8 th -10 th centuries) Digital humanities tools (databases) Development of activities for the dissemination of the heritage, which allows the knowledge acquired by studies to be given back to society. Acronym & Agreement Nº  CATCAR  EFA296/19  Project number  EFA296/19  Project title  CATCAR: Patrimonio digital al servicio de la innovación social  IP  Dr Ignasi J. Baiges Jardí  Department  Departament d'Història i Arqueologia  Gross salary per month  1.500,00€  Required documents  Application letter and curriculum vitae including list of publications  Send Your Application To  email  click apply  Name  Dr Ignasi Baiges Jardí  email subject  Temporary part time researcher – CATCAR  Type of contract  Temporary (6 months with the eventual extension of 2 months)  Job status Select one  full-time   X   part-time  Hours per week  18,75 hores  Application deadline  16-11-2020  Job Starting Date  01-12-2020

Title: Senior Data Scientist (ASL) - Advanced Analytics - Marketing & Sales
Description: About ASL In Nestlé  We are a diverse, international team of Analytical professionals applying advanced analytics solutions in the world’s biggest health, nutrition and wellness company.  As an internal consultancy, we collaborate with our colleagues in sales & marketing around the world to deliver value in the areas of marketing effectiveness, and price & promo effectiveness.  In order to complete our Analytics Service Line department, we are currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist / Modeller with FMCG experience in Marketing Mix Modelling and Price & Promo Analytics.  Position Snapshot  Location: Nestlé Global Hub in Barcelona, Spain Permanent Contract Bachelor’s degree Fluent English About You  You are an expert in applying advanced analytics to solve marketing and sales business problems. You are equally comfortable applying your knowledge to optimize marketing spend or working with sales to optimize trade spend.  You are hands on in your ability to build models, but you are also comfortable coaching less experienced team members in how to solve problems, or managing agencies to deliver where needed.  You know that having a great model isn’t enough, you love to derive the “so what” from you models and tell compelling stories which inspire action and drive growth.  A day in the life of...  You’ll be responsible for using advanced analytics to provide robust measurements of marketing & trade investment across different business models, product categories and varied geographies.  You will work closely with your stakeholders to provide guidance on how best to optimize and allocate marketing & trade investments in order to support the delivery of our commercial strategy.  As part of this role you will need to:  Share your experience & knowledge and build Nestlé’s internal modelling capability Partner with stakeholders to build and deliver a portfolio of advanced analytics initiatives Work closely with to identify and answer business problems/questions using appropriate modeling techniques on available data Evangelize and provide advisory services around data science capabilities and knowledge within Nestlé Work with large, complex data sets and solve non-standard problems What Will Make You Successful  Be educated to MSc level (or equivalent) in Math, Statistics, Physics, Operations Research, Econometrics or Data Science. Have proven experience of handling large datasets and reporting automation. Be able to demonstrate an excellent understanding of marketing mix modelling and price & promotion analytics. Experience with dynamic linear models/state space models is of particular interest. Have the ability to network and influence at senior levels both internally and externally. Be able to interpret data and explain business performance in an easy to understand way that tells a story to key stakeholders. Have proven experience of working in a matrix environment: achieving results through effective influencing and collaboration. Have advanced MS Excel, SQL, R, Python (or similar) experience. Join us!  Show us that you are an enthusiastic, motivated, fast learner and team player person who is used to work with agile practices. Your ability to be flexible, self-motivated and your willingness to do whatever it takes to deliver on a deadline will set you apart among the other candidates. Please do not hesitate and apply in English at www.nestle.com/jobs. We are excited to hear from you!    The Nestlé Group is the world’s largest food and beverage company with 89.8 billion Swiss Francs in sales in 2017. It is present in 189 countries around the world, has 413 factories and its 323,000 employees are committed to Nestlé’s purpose of enhancing quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Nestlé offers a wide portfolio of products and services for people and their pets throughout their lives. Its more than 2000 brands range from global icons like Nescafé or Nespresso to local favourites. Company performance is driven by its Nutrition, Health and Wellness strategy. Nestlé is based in the Swiss town of Vevey where it was founded more than 150 years ago. Learn more about our Group and reasons to join us on www.nestle.com.
Industries: Artículos de consumo, Alimentación y bebidas, Producción alimentaria

Title: Senior Data Engineer (Databricks, BigQuery, AWS, Python)
Description: LocationMadrid Are you looking for a new position within a data driven IT consultancy?A disrupting IT consultancy is presently welcoming a new experienced Senior Data Engineer to join the Engineering team enabling the company to draw relevant insights from a large amount of data. Title: Statistician for Non-Communicable Diseases and Environment Research Programme - Barcelona
Description: Descripción  The Barcelona Institute for Global Health (ISGlobal) is a cutting-edge institute addressing global public health challenges through research, translation into policy and education. ISGlobal has a broad portfolio in communicable and non-communicable diseases including environmental and climate determinants, and applies a multidisciplinary scientific approach ranging from the molecular to the population level. Research is organized in three main areas, Malaria and other Infectious Diseases, Child and Maternal Health, and Urban Health, Climate & Non-Communicable Diseases. ISGlobal is accredited with the Severo Ochoa distinction, a seal of excellence of the Spanish Science Ministry.    Lugar   Barcelona - Campus Mar    What we are looking for   ISGlobal is seeking a  statistician/data scientist to join our dynamic team. The statistician will be involved in exciting projects related to physical activity/mobility, sleep behavior, urban environments and health, with a strong focus on respiratory health and idiographic analyses. The statistician will work with large datasets from multiple sources: clinical data with repeated measurements, environmental exposure data (e.g., residential air pollution), data from activity monitors including “high-resolution” time series data, among other data sources. The role requires close collaboration with international project partners from a range of disciplines as well as researchers at ISGlobal. The successful applicant will be supervised by Non-Communicable Diseases and Environment Programme Head Dr Judith Garcia-Aymerich, Research Professor, and eHealth Group Leader Dr Guillaume Chevance, Assistant Research Professor.    Training and Experience   Higher education in Biostatistics or similar.   Knowledge of theoretical and applied statistics.   Programming using the main statistical tools and software in R and Stata.  Experience with mixed models for repeated measures data, use of quantitative methods, time series analysis and interpretation of longitudinal and intensive-longitudinal data derived from large cohort studies or single participants followed over extended period of time.   Experience in Data-management    Key Responsibilities   Perform data cleaning and management   Perform statistical analysis of longitudinal observational data, in particular time-series data and longitudinal cohort data.   Provide statistical support to the researchers of the team.    Additional responsabilities   Contribute to scientific publications, reports, and grant applications.   Participate to protocol writing and statistical analysis plan elaboration. Skills  Proficient use of statistical software R and STATA  Good verbal and written communication skills   Critical thinking skills and ability to work independently.   Excellent organizational skills and comfortable working in a multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural team.  Good level of the English (written and spoken)
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Investigación, Biotecnología, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria

Title: Consultoría | Senior FrontEnd y BackEnd // Hub Málaga
Description: PwC, Firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio.La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Analytics y Business Security Solutions.En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics dos profesionales senior con perfil de Frontend y Backend para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado.  Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PwC en Málaga, Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo.Perfil BackEnd: profesional con al menos 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo con Python. Requisitos:- Ingeniería Superior: Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar.- Experiencia en tratamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos, en entornos tradicionales o Big Data.- ETLs.- Desarrollo de software, preferiblemente con Python.- Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos analíticos, machine learning, data mining.- Integración de sistemas.- Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server...)- Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua.- Sistema de control de versiones Git.- Metodologías ágiles.- Conocimiento de tecnología Apache Spark y/o Hadoop.- Nivel alto de inglésPerfil FrontEnd: profesional con al menos 3 años de experiencia. Requisitos:- Ing. Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar.- Experiencia de 2-3 años demostrable en Proyectos FrontEnd.- Buen dominio de Javascript y TypeScript. Además buen conocimiento de ECMAScript 6.- Experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Responsive de una sola página, sólida experiencia con Angular 2+.- Experiencia en diseño de soluciones front (Bootstrap o material design).-Experiencia con bibliotecas de gráficos (Highcharts, plotly, D3)-Experiencia con sistemas de control de versiones (Git y GitHub). - Experiencia con metodologías ágiles (marco SCRUM) y prácticas de Integración Continua. - Nivel alto de inglés  - Se valorará positivamente experiencia adicional sobre: experiencia en JS frameworks (VueJS, React) y Conocimiento UX/UI (Figma, Sketch, Zeplin)  Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)Degrees/Field of Study required:Degrees/Field of Study preferred: Certifications  (if blank, certifications not specified)  Desired Languages  (If blank, desired languages not specified) Travel RequirementsNot SpecifiedAvailable for Work Visa Sponsorship?YesGovernment Clearance Required?NoJob Posting End Date

Title: Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Integrative Genetics)
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Integrative Genetics) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To Contribute to genetics-driven drug discovery in a range of disease areas (auto-immune, neurological, cardiovascular and others)Develop novel approaches to combine genetics evidence with additional layers of data, e.g. single-cell data sets, to link genetic variation to phenotypic propertiesApply these methods to derive target hypotheses, linked to clearly defined patient biologyContribute to the identification of suitable in-vitro models and validation scenarios  Requirements PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publicationsStrong background in human genetics researchExpertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor)Experience analyzing high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etcExperience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageousAttention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.Verbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Recursos humanos, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria
