Title: 6G Researcher - Barcelona
Description: The AI-driven Systems Research Area led by ICREA's Professor Xavier Costa is looking for a talented researcher with a strong background in the field of mobile networks and experience in applied AI. The Scientific group focuses its research and development activities on new challenging concepts, such as network/RAN virtualization, network programmability, network slicing, mmwave, smart surfaces, etc. with a particular interest on their applications towards the society digital transformation. Expected 6G use cases, such as AI-based automation of mobile networks, mission-critical communications and wireless sensing, will be carefully evaluated and corresponding solutions will be designed and implemented in our lab premises.  The work focuses on the analytical evaluation of solutions designed as well as proof of concepts both for public and industrial R&D projects in collaboration with industrial and academic partners.  Work objectives are concept studies and evaluation, research prototype software development, publications as well as IPR creation. The research work will be carried out in an international team of researchers.  Who We Are  i2CAT Foundation is a non-profit research and innovation centre that promotes mission oriented R&D activities on advanced Internet architectures, applications and services. The centre stands for a new open innovation framework, fostering the collaboration between companies, public administration, the academic environment and end-users.  i2CAT’s activities span the areas of Research, playing a key role in the EU Framework Program for Research and Innovation: Strategic Projects, leading local initiatives that strengthen the digital policies of public administration, and Technology Transfer, fostering R&D collaboration with companies to develop innovative market-oriented solutions.  Want to know more? Visit our webpage!  What Do We Offer You will be part of a multicultural team. We have a fun loving and friendly international work environment.Be in contact and work with cutting-edge technologyWork in challenging R&D projectsA full-time fixed term, of initial duration of 3 years. The contract may be extended till the end of the projectFix + variable salaryOption of flexible retribution (restaurant card, transport card, medical insurance, kindergarten)Flexible working schedule - We know you have a life outside of work and we will work with you to make sure it's kept that wayFridays afternoon offIntensive work schedule in July & AugustHome-office optionOpen space office in BarcelonaFree fruit every weekDiscounted Gym-access25 vacation days per yearCasual dress codeLet us know which trainings you needYou will have the opportunity to attend tech conferences and events. The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and, therefore explicitly, encourages women to apply.  The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of persons with disabilities among its workforce, and therefore explicitly encourages this collective to apply.  Applications Should Include Cover letter stating the motivation and suitability of the candidate  Minimum Requirements PhD degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or Computer ScienceResearch publications in top-tier venuesExcellent academic recordMobile network architecture and protocolsArtificial Intelligence basicsData Science basicsNetwork virtualization conceptsNetwork programmabilityOperational networks traces analysisNetwork optimization modelsPrototyping for PoC demonstrationsSoftware development under UNIX-based system (Linux, FreeBSD etc.)  Desired Requirements Participation in EU funded research projectsInternational experience as a postdoc researcherExperience preparing project proposalsExperience as a research team leader/mentoring of studentsExperience with AI frameworks, e.g. pytorch ...Practical experience with commercial network equipment Access points, base stations, switches, EPC, ...Software-defined Radio (SDR) such as FPGA (e.g., NI USRP), mmwave COTSmmwave networksWireless SensingIPR generation experienceTeaching
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Internet, Dotación y selección de personal, Recursos humanos

Title: Data Engineer
Description: ¿Qué es Unlimiteck?Unlimiteck es un company builder experta en conceptualizar, diseñar, crear y operar startups con base tecnológica. Somos #DREAMERS, pero sobre todo #MAKERS. Nuestra metodología de trabajo funciona porque está basada en el conocimiento del mercado, en la utilización de equipos pequeños pero especializados, en la continua adaptación al cambio y en sentir verdadera pasión por la innovación. Financiamos nuestras propias startups, ponemos a su disposición el stack tecnológico necesario y así garantizamos sus primeros meses de vida mientras se centran en el desarrollo del negocio. Hasta el momento hemos puesto en marcha con éxito cinco startups y tenemos previsto crear otras cinco en los próximos años. Además, trabajamos y colaboramos estrechamente con grandes corporaciones involucradas en el mundo de la innovación y el emprendimiento. Nuestro mejor activo son las personas. Contamos con un equipo diverso, joven, inclusivo y multicultural que trabaja en lo que ama y que logra cumplir todos los retos que se le plantean gracias a una organización horizontal y una cultura empresarial única.Nos encontramos en perpetuo estado de aprendizaje y mejora (always in beta), pero si hay algo que tenemos muy claro, es que para alcanzar el éxito es imprescindible contar con el mejor talento. Y eso es lo que buscamos. El equipoUnlimiteck está formado por equipos reducidos y altamente especializados. Distintos perfiles profesionales se complementan y colaboran entre sí, favoreciendo un ambiente y un flujo de trabajo eficiente y dinámico. MetioraLa inteligencia de las cosas conectadas ha alterado para siempre la forma en la que funcionan el sector retail y de gran consumo. El objetivo de Metiora es ayudar a sus clientes a identificar oportunidades de negocio y a tomar las decisiones correctas gracias a su plataforma basada en IA, Data Science e IoT.Estamos actualmente buscando a un Data Scientist para incorporarse en el equipo de Metiora. FUNCIONES DEL PUESTO:Diseño e implementación de DW y herramientas de Business IntelligenceRecopilación de requisitos, análisis y diseño de procesos ETL, almacenamiento de datos, bases de datos multidimensionales y cubos OLAP.Entrega de análisis de datos y dashboards a usuarios finales mediante plataformas de Data Science usando código Python para mejorar la toma de decisiones de nuestros clientesConstrucción de demostradores, procesos de test de herramienta y validación de datosAnálisis de datos y pretratado de información Generación de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial y MVP complejosGeneración de dashboards para mejorar la toma de decisiones de nuestros clientesSeguimiento de las herramientas desarrolladas con clientesParticipar en el proceso de mejora de productos de la empresa, así como en la toma de decisiones y el desarrollo de los proyectos.Mantener un alto nivel de conocimiento del sobre tendencias de técnicas de Business Analytics, Data Science e IoT REQUISITOS:Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Física, Matemáticas, Ingeniería de Datos, Electrónica, Estadística.Al menos 5 años de experiencia en proyectos reales, manejo de python y su stack de data science y visualizacion de datos(pandas, sklearn, numpy, etc.).Conocimientos en tecnología Cloud, Azure DataLake, Azure Storage, HDInsight.Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales (PostgreSQL, SQL) y no relacionales (MongoDB / Redis / Clickhouse) y cubos OLAP.Capacidad para comunicarse con clientes de primer nivel.Foco en la calidad, escalabilidad y código limpio. Conocimientos de limpieza y manejo de datos para su posterior análisis, procesos ETLCapacidad de abstracción y resolución de problemas. Se valora positivamente: Certificaciones oficiales de Microsoft y AWS relacionadasConocimientos en tecnología Big Data, Databricks, Apache Hadoop, Apache Sparks, DatabricksDesarrollo, despliegue y mantenimiento de modelos predictivos en producciónConceptos de scrapping y manejo de librerías como Selenium Conocimientos de Deep Learning (keras) y Reinforcement Learning (OpenAI Gym) Buen nivel de inglés Manejo de la visualización de datos para la generación de reportes Proactividad y pasión por la tecnología Ganas de trabajar en equipo Curiosidad intelectual y persistencia para resolver problemasConocimientos en consultoría tecnológica Qué ofrecemos:Oportunidad de prosperar en un entorno de emprendimiento de alto crecimientoContrato indefinido ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!Salario competitivo y beneficios de empresaGrandes compañeros con los aprender y trabajarCientos de problemas para resolver
Functions: Ingeniería, Tecnología de la información, Gestión de proyectos
Industries: Desarrollo de programación

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Madrid, España Indefinido Experiencia de 6 meses a 5 años  En Gfi Buscamos Perfiles De  Data Engineer expertos en desarrollar en Oracle, PL/SQl, y Tableau para importante proyecto internacional dentro del sector bancario.  Funciones  Actualización y creación de procesos Oracle diarios. Optimización del proceso existente. Crear nuevos ETL a partir de diferentes fuentes de datos. Creación y optimización de fuentes de datos para el equipo de visualización. Desarrollo de métricas, informes, cuadros de mando y visualización para diferentes stakeholders y departamentos. Incluye la distribución, el mantenimiento y la validación de estos informes y cuadros de mando.  Requisitos  Perfil proactivo y dinámico, con capacidad de interlocución, con experiencia en informes y desarrollo. Desarrollador experto en Oracle, ETL, creando y actualizando procesos diarios. PL / SQL, Tableau, Java, JavaScript, secuencias de comandos Unix, jsp, html, Python Inglés alto (se utilizará a diario y desde el primer día puesto que trabajarán junto con equipos internacionales europeos y estadounidenses) Lugar de trabajo: Madrid (inicialmente se teletrabajará)  Se Ofrece  Contrato Indefinido Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento Plan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes. Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc. Flexibilidad horaria  Descripción de la empresa  Gfi Grupo es una multinacional de consultaría, outsourcing e integración de sistemas en Tecnologías de la información, con un equipo de más de 19.000 empleados, presente en 21 países y cuatro continentes. Tras 48 años de historia, la compañía se ha consolidado convirtiéndose en un referente en el mercado europeo dentro de sus sectores de actividad: Banca y Seguros, Telecomunicaciones , Energía y Utilities, Administraciones Públicas, Industria y Salud. La generación de un volumen de negocio de 136,2 millones de euros, así como su cotización en la Bolsa Euronext de París, avalan su posición en el mercado. Gfi España cuenta con una plantilla de más de 2.900 profesionales altamente cualificados, y más de 19 oficinas repartidas por todo el territorio nacional. ¿Por qué elegirnos? Porque en Gfi buscamos profesionales COMO TÚ, con interés en participar en proyectos de alta tecnología en el sector de las TIC, con capacidad de innovación y dispuestos a lograr el éxito personal y profesional. Porque podrás trabajar en proyectos de gran envergadura en destacados clientes, formando equipo con grandes profesionales del sector. Porque combinamos lo mejor de la gran empresa (oportunidades y desarrollo) y lo mejor de la pequeña (cercanía y flexibilidad). Porque Gfi apuesta por las personas como única vía para crecer, nuestros profesionales representan el activo más importante de la compañía, de ahí que más del 85% de estos se encuentren actualmente de manera indefinida y con amplias perspectivas de desarrollo profesional. ¿Que Ofrecemos? Atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento, participando en diversidad de proyectos en tecnologías punteras. Incorporación a un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados, trabajando en un ambiente agradable, emprendedor y flexible. Formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.  Retribución a la carta. Podrás elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Recursos humanos

Title: DATA ENGINEER
Description: Ref. IT – 42/2020  Oferta de empleo: Data Engineer (Madrid).  Nuestro cliente es una es una consultora IT que asesora a empresas multinacionales en las áreas de desarrollo de software, gestión de proyectos y coordinación técnica, apoyando a la dirección de la compañía en la toma de decisiones y colaborando en la optimización de sus procesos.  Se encuentran en una fase de continua expansión y su modelo de negocio se soporta en tres pilares fundamentales:  – Consultoría tecnológica especializada. – Optimización y Automatización. – Desarrollos a medida.  Trabajan en un entorno tecnológico vanguardista (Computación de Alto Rendimiento HPC, Big Data, AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, iOS, Android, Python, Java, ELK, RPA,…).  La Posición  Se precisa la incorporación de 1 DATA ENGINEER a un proyecto que se ejecuta para una importante multinacional del sector farmacéutico.  Se trata de un proyecto de larga duración y con continuidad de innovación tecnológica que consiste en desarrollar un sistema de monitorización en tiempo real de procesos de negocio, integrando información de diferentes fuentes de datos y aplicando técnicas de Machine Learning para detectar anomalías de forma preventiva. Sobre este sistema se montaría un cuadro de mando para la dirección de la compañía.  Experiencia y Personal Skills Al menos 3 años de experiencia desarrollando con Python (Requests, Flask, Pandas).SQL.ElasticSearch.Pyspark.AWS (ec2, s3)Jupyter NotebooksConocimientos de LinuxBuen “team player”, proactivo, con ganas de aprender, enseñar y liderar el proyecto desde el punto de vista técnico.  Otros Conocimientos Valorables y Que Serán Un Plus Networkx – gráficos redes.Series temporales.AWS ( Redshift).Automatización procesos.GIT.Buen nivel de ingles a nivel oral y escrit Condiciones Contrato: indefinidoSalario: 34.000 – 38.000 euros b/aActualmente Full Remote de manera indefinida.Zona: Alcobendas En caso de interés puedes aplicar tu candidatura enviado tu CV a través del formulario de contacto de esta página.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Recursos humanos

Title: Junior Data Engineer (Recién graduado)
Description: Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Física, Matemáticas o Ingeniería de Datos. Sólidos conocimientos de principios de programación y de algoritmos y estructuras de datos. Conocimientos de Programación Orientada a Objetos. Conocimientos de terminal UNIX. Conocimientos de SQL. Capacidad de abstracción y resolución de problemas. Proactividad y pasión por la tecnología. Ganas de trabajar en equipo. Curiosidad intelectual y persistencia para resolver problemas.  Valorable  Buen nivel de inglés. Conocimientos en lenguajes de scripting. Conocimientos en programación funcional. Conocimientos de redes. Conocimientos en tecnologías del ecosistema Big Data. Conocimientos en bases de datos (relacionales y no relacionales).  ¿Qué te ofrecemos?  Oportunidad de prosperar en un entorno de emprendimiento de alto crecimiento. Trabajar con las últimas tecnologías del mercado y actualización continua de conocimientos. Posibilidad de acceso a formación gratuita en las últimas tecnologías. Salario competitivo y beneficios de empresa. Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo! Grandes compañeros con los que aprender y trabajar. Imprescindible haber finalizado: Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Física, Matemáticas o Ingeniería de Datos.
Industries: Telecomunicaciones, Banca, Servicios financieros

Title: Game Data Analyst / Scientist
Description: Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international  team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny and cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, played and loved by over 50 million  fans all over the world.  Join us and help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.  About The Role  As a  Game Data Analyst / Scientist  in our global Analytics team you will work to understand our gamers' behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention and user conversion.  Applying quantitative analysis, statistics and programming , you'll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you'll need to learn quickly and work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams and Heads of Product.  You Will  Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.  Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .   Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.   Acting as the  liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.   Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.   Using predictive analytics to predict  how users will react to changes in the Games.  You Have  3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.   A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.   Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.   Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.   Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.   A passion for turning data into actionable insights.   You are fluent in written and spoken English.   Solid skills visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.  You Are  A passionate gamer, this is a must!   Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.   A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.   Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.   A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win   Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.  What We Offer You  Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn't stopped us from offering these great benefits!: You'll get the newest and most powerful devices and equipment to work with, along with a Spotify Premium account An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!  Private medical insurance, just in case. Free Language Lessons. People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you and our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities! And when we return to the office later this year:  Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus! Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football and basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist. 'An apple a day keeps the doctor away' so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!  Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues. Drop by our hairdresser's for a trim (and forget your wallet). If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons and help with all your boring paperwork! The list just goes on and on... so get your game on and apply now!
Industries: Videojuegos

Title: Data Engineer
Description: If you love working with Data and want to be part of an amazing company, then this job is for you!  We are looking for a Data Engineer that is a big fan of data, likes to predict and elaborate complex algorithms.  First things first… top project details!  We are looking for a top profile to join a top team of more than 350 people who are really passionate about technology. You’ll join to a Microsoft partner company specialized in AI, doesn’t sound bad at all, does it?  With offices in different locations such Seattle, London, Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Benelux, Bilbao or Barcelona… you will join a multicultural team that shares values as innovation, passion for technology, transparency, horizontal hierarchy, adaptability...you feel identified, right? well… is doesn’t end here! In your day to day you’ll work with your team on Big Data and ML projects, you can even join other projects that are not your priority as long as you don’t forget your focus. Learning and continuing to grow matters!!  And if you ask yourself… what is my career projection? Well, the development of talent is one of the main focuses for them and you will always be accompanied to grow across, horizontally or vertically, you set your limits!!  Your mission 🚀  You will work hand by hand with the Data team inside the Big Data department. You also will work on the design of Data Lake architectures and implement ETL with Spark. It’s important that you have knowledge with Azure because you will work on Big Data processing with Azure DataBricks. And if you like the cloud part… this continues… you will help to develop a Cloud Data Warehouse. Also is important to mentionate that you’ll work implementing data pipelines with airflow, data factory...  Perks, my friend!  Competitive salary  Flexible schedule and remote work (Personal and professional conciliation is important!)  Private medical insurance + Flexible compensation  Relocation package (if you are not in Barcelona, we can help you to move to this wonderful city!)  Breakfast at the office….charging energy! Modern offices with great city views.  If this is you – holy cow! 🐄  +3 years of experience in a similar position. We are looking for capabilities and authentic seniors on Data world!  Super if you have experience working with Scala. We like to work in an updated way, we want to share that feeling with you.  Good knowledge of .Net or Java.  Great if you have experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.  Good to have experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools.  Marvelous if you have experience with Azure cloud services.  Really important for us!!If you have experience with stream processing systems… all in!: Azure Stream Analytics, Spark-Streaming…  Great to have experience with: C#, Python, Scala…  If this is also you – JACKPOT! 🍒🍒🍒  Great if you are a team player, always up to bringing new ideas to the table!  Good if you are used to working in an international, multicultural and dynamic environment. We want to meet you and bring us a little of yourself!  If you have a business mindset, wonderful!  Good to have experience with Data Lake architecture.  Cool if you have experience working with big data tools such as: Hadoop, Spark…  Let’s have a chat and GetWith us! 😊
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Internet

Title: ROBOTICS RESEARCHER
Description: Job Description  The Robotics and Automation Unit of Eurecat Technology Center (Barcelona) is looking for a highly motivated researcher to work in different aspects of Robotics depending on background and experience.  This vacancy is seeking people with passion for robotics research. The candidate shall work on different research projects with robotics. Our research group is focused on aerial and ground robots, as well as perception and manipulation for industrial and collaborative applications. The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments including  Development of robotics software algorithms.  Participate in the definition and development of new robotic platforms  Develop, validate and maintain code  Sporadic support\/supervision to drone integration and maintenance  Participate in scientific publications  Support to project management to ensure proper project execution  Establish and maintain contact with clients and partners in consortium  These Are The Links Of Our Current And Previous Publicly Available Robotics Projects  What Eurecat can offer you The Robotics Group is specialized in research and development on Ground, Aerial and Industrial Robotics. With a strong focus on our customers and partners needs, our mission is to enhance the capabilities and reliability of autonomous systems operating in realistic scenarios, improving the existing technology and enabling new applications. For over 10 years, the group has been involved in several of the most successful European projects in robotics.  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/sharework\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/maf\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/ecofibra\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/icarus\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/aerial-robot-for-sewer-inspection\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/built2spec-2\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/nature4cities\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/geomove\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/grape\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/logimatic\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/maic\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/bots2rec\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/es\/portfolio-items\/mood2be\/  http:\/\/www.assets4rail.eu\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/vizta\/  Check others in: https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/field-of-knowledge\/robotics-automation\/  Our laboratory is located in Cerdanyola del Vallès, in the outskirts of Barcelona city (Spain). Barcelona besides being easily connected to the rest of Europe, provides a great quality of life and a great robotics ecosystem full of initiatives, research groups, robotics companies and interesting events. And many more to come!
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Investigación

Title: Data Engineer
Description: DescriptionPlain Concepts es una empresa tecnológica fundada en 2006 por 4 MVPs de Microsoft. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas apasionadas por la tecnología, movidas por el cambio y sin miedo a romper cosas en busca de la mejor solución. Nos encanta ayudar a nuestros clientes con sus desafíos tecnológicos. Disfrutamos compartiendo nuestro conocimiento con ellos, especialmente cuando se trata de las últimas innovaciones.Con el tiempo nos hemos convertido en una multinacional con oficinas en Seattle, Londres, Ámsterdam, Frankfurt, Madrid, Barcelona, Bilbao, Sevilla, León, La Coruña, Zaragoza y Santander, que está en constante crecimiento.Lo que nos defineTrabajamos para cliente desde nuestras oficinas (no hacemos body shopping)Somos un equipo multidisciplinar con una estructura organizativa plana y horizontalEstamos comprometidos con los valores ágilesBuscamos ser una referencia inspiradora a través de nuestro trabajoNos apasiona compartir nuestros conocimientos con los demás.Nos animamos y apoyamos mutuamente para participar en la comunidad y hablar en conferenciasNos esforzamos constantemente para ser creativos e innovadoresSomos transparentes con nuestros clientes, lo que nos ayuda a construir relaciones satisfactorias con ellosQué hacemosDesarrollamos soluciones a medida y proyectos desde 0 para cualquier necesidad de nuestros clientes, realizando desde el diseño hasta la puesta en producción. Nos mueve la curiosidad y por ello también impartimos formaciones y workshops (siempre con las últimas tecnologías, incluso versiones beta).En general, estamos muy especializados en tecnologías Microsoft, aunque esto no limita nuestro ecosistema tecnológico. En nuestros últimos proyectos han estado involucradas, entre otras, las siguientes tecnologías:- Cloud Platforms (Azure, Office365)- Web (MVC, WebApi, ASP.Net Core, ECMAScript 2015, NodeJS)- Big Data (Hadoop, NoSQL, R, Machine Learning)- IoT (Internet of Things)- Universal Windows Platform (Windows 10, Xbox apps, HoloLens apps)- Video games and multimedia (Wave engine)- Mobile Apps (Xamarin, Cordova)RequirementsBuscamos Data Engineers para formar parte de nuevos proyectos desarrollo dentro del área de Big Data en nuestra oficina de Barcelona.Funciones que realizarás:Diseñarás arquitecturas Data Lake. Realizarás implementaciones de ETL con Spark.Harás el procesamiento de Big Data con Azure DataBricks.Desarrollarás un Data Warehouse en Cloud.Implementarás pipelines de datos con herramientas de mercado: airflow, data factory...Proporcionarás soporte a nivel de consultoría técnica al departamento de desarrollo de negocio para mejorar los procesos de digitalización. También podrás colaborar en el desarrollo de proyectos de innovación.Conocimientos y experiencia que valoramos: Experiencia en el desarrollo de sistemas de procesamiento de datos con Spark basado en Python o Scala para un gran conjunto de datos en entorno Azure / AWS Cloud.Experiencia en desarrollo de ETLs en Spark, tanto en batch como en streaming.Experiencia con Microsoft Azure, DataBricks.Experiencia creando CI/CD pipelines.Implementación de test unitario.Valorable experiencia con NoSQL.Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas o equivalentes, con experiencia relevante. Que otras cosas buscamos:Buen nivel de inglés (entorno internacional).Pasión por el uso de datos y análisis para impulsar el valor empresarial.Buena interacción y capacidad de trabajo con los diferentes equipos de las oficinas a nivel global.Constantes ganas de aprender y habilidad de adaptación.Buenas prácticas y metodologías ágiles de trabajo.Team Player.Benefits Que ofrecemos?:Nuestro objetivo es crear una empresa donde los empleados disfruten de beneficios que los hagan más productivos y contribuyan directamente al desarrollo de sus habilidades profesionales. Queremos poder atraer lo mejor de lo mejor y asegurarnos de que sigan mejorando. Además de un lugar de trabajo emocionante, vibrante e intelectualmente desafiante y un salario competitivo, ofrecemos:Ser parte de un equipo ágil e internacionalFormar parte de una de las empresas Best Place to WorkPlain Camp anualRetribución flexibleGimnasioSeguro médico (incluida parte dental)Fruta, refrescos, café y desayunos incluidosHorario flexible, posibilidad de trabajar ocasionalmente desde casaFormación continua (workshops internos y acceso a formación)Clases de inglésEn Plain Concepts, sin duda, buscamos ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades. Queremos solicitantes con diversidad sin importar la raza, color, género, religión, nacionalidad, ciudadanía, discapacidad, edad, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.Job SummaryID: 4C6B330093Department: ()Type: full time
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Internet

Title: Data Engineer - BI, Madrid
Description: Data Engineer - BI en Madrid Kiteris Data (the Data Science group into Kiteris Solutions) is looking for a Data Engineer to join their growing team of analytics experts.  You will be responsible for the evolution of existing analytical applications and creating new ones from scratch.  So, a good mixture of the below technical skills required:  Experience developing Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik,.. or similar.Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, such as Postgres, MsSQL Server, MongoDB, etc. Good knowledge of Hadoop ecosystems.  Experience in cloud platforms as Google cloud, AWS and Azure cloud services, DataBricks, etc.Experience with object-oriented languages: Python, Java, R, etc.Strong Python programming skills required to develop data connectors to the main marketing APIs (social, display, web analytics…) and data transformation applications.Experience with Reporting Services.Valorable experience in marketing data sources (DCM, Sizmek, DSPs, Facebook…).GitMandatory reading and writing technical english In return for your services you will be rewarded with a good salary with excellent company benefits.  Working in Madrid.  Permanent position.  Please apply for immediate consideration.  Python, R, PoweBi, Qlik, Tableau

Title: Technical Researcher - Seville
Description: The Role We are looking for a Technical Researcher that will develop and update our Solera Databaseswith all necessary information coming from Automotive Manufacturers.   What You’ll   Do  Research andanalyzeManufacturer data  Accurately develop our automotive database with technical informationprovided by manufacturer   To produce the quantity of data files at the quality agreed periodically   To improve the quality of the data files in line with company targets   To collaborate actively with the Data & Content Creationteam   To provide input for the preparation of production plans and forecasts   To analyze output reports and initiate corrective action.   Maintainup to date knowledge of new vehicle releases and new technologies   Wh  at You  ’ll  Bring  High-Level Technical qualification in automotive technology or Bachelor’s degree in mechanical/electrical engineering  Detailedknowledge in automotive repairs and processes   Good understandingofother kind of vehicles: trucks, motorbikes, agriculture, …   At least 1 year in practical experience in automotive industry car repairs   Fluent Windows and MS Office user   Proficientuser knowledge of Automotive Documentation (Parts,labourcatalogues and workshop repair manuals).   B1 English skills as a minimum. Technical knowledge   German knowledge is valuable  Benefits  Tickets restaurant  private insurance  bonus scheme.  Compensation : 18k - 19k

Title: Data Engineer Barcelona
Description: Job DescriptionAbout AccentureAccenture Is a Leading Global  professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation. About Supply Chain and Operations Applied IntelligencePart of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships. The Barcelona Innovation Centerhas been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance. Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs. Data Engineer roleIntroductionYou will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.Your role  To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise  Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution  Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations  Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.  A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworksKey Responsibilities  Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.  Design the integration with legacy data sources.  Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.  Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.  Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy. Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.  Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality  Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals  Build high-performance algorithms,  Prototypes, And Proof Of ConceptsQualifications Skills  you will need Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP. SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB Other database tools, e.g. SCADA Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred) Unix and Unix-like systems Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA. Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description: Are you ready for a new challenge?  Celonis is the leader in business transformation software, turning process insights into action with The Celonis Intelligent Business Cloud, built on the process mining technology it pioneered.  We are growing our data engineering team. This team is responsible for the design, development, and governance of our internal data warehouse which is leveraged to analyse and inform internal business processes and decisions to assist in making our company more efficient and our processes superfluid.  As a Data Engineer in the Finance department you will play a key role in transitioning the organisation to a newly-implemented EDW using our own software. In this role, you will build up data structures, assist in system maintenance and data requests, and identify the best strategy for the data collection to gather all relevant information. You will work together with many different stakeholders within the company to support, maintain, and scope data management and governance policies.  This is an exciting journey to build the foundation of global analytics at Celonis, from analytics used for data-driven decision making to turning our own processes into extraordinary experiences.  Responsibilities  Be part of an innovative team that drives our Celonis on Celonis initiative and uses our software to dive into our business processes to determine root causes, quantify potential, and establish and drive improvement initiatives that make our business more efficient Set up and maintain data structures that will be the basis of the analyses and work closely together with the business analysts to generate a standard set of/canonical tables and views Be the primary contact for the planning, installation and integration of our internal IBC, as well as for answering and documenting technical questions Provide tiered internal support to our departmental customers Responsible for setting data dictionaries and maintaining data governance on the created structure Work to identify the best possible strategy for data collection, ensure the data quality, and work together with the stakeholders responsible for the data input to ensure we can correctly measure and track all necessary information Collaborate with IT system experts to ensure the IT systems are set up correctly to gather all relevant information and support the most effective data structures  YOU... have relevant work experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or database managementhave basic knowledge of SQL and enjoy wrangling data: Scripting language experience a plusare a team player and a great communicator, able to translate business needs into analytical concepts and data requirementshave worked with data from cloud software and API'shave a completed degree (MSc/BSc) in management information systems (MIS), or similar WE...  see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test … offer attractive compensation models (best-in-class salary, stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, …)  are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world … are experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations … distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible work  Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Title: HOME-BASED DATA ENGINEER - Madrid
Description: HOME-BASED DATA ENGINEER en Madrid, ESPAÑA (m/f)  Buscamos un  Data Engineer (puesto de nueva creación) para unirse de manera remota o presencial a una compañía puntera en el desarrollo de soluciones y plataformas tecnológicas de Inteligencia Artificial (Analytics y Machine Learning) orientadas a optimizar la toma de decisiones de negocio aplicadas a la industria energética.  Es la oportunidad de unirse a una start-up que ya está en fase de scale-up y clara expansión en el horizonte 2020-2024 (con la solidez de una gran multinacional detrás y una gran inversión en I+D) e integrarse en un equipo de alto rendimiento, ágil y flexible que, a través de sus proyectos, pretende trascender desde la tecnología hacia modelos más sostenibles energéticamente.   FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES  Su Misión La Vertebraran 3 Pilares  Esta figura se encargará, principalmente, de la  Infraestructura y trabajará de manera transversal en todos los proyectos de la compañía.  Adquisición de Datos : Deberá hacerse cargo de los múltiples servicios de adquisición de datos existentes en la compañía: oExtracción de datos provenientes de los dispositivos IoT (Streaming): Se trata de emplear un sistema que permita leer los datos que cada minuto se envían desde los múltiples dispositivos IoT instalados a lo largo de las instalaciones energéticas del cliente. Ahora emplean Apache Beam (con Google Cloud Dataflow como runner), tecnología de Apache semejante a Spark Streaming o Apache Flink, por lo que deberá manejarse en esta tecnología o en aquella que pueda proponer para mejorar el sistema.  oExtracción de datos provenientes de BBDD del cliente (Batch cronológico): Sus clientes necesitan, en muchos casos, la elaboración de servicios de adquisición de datos específicos para cada tecnología (desde servidores FTP, sistemas SCADA o bases de datos relacionales), por lo que deberá encargarse de los sistemas actualmente implementados y valorar mejoras, así como implementar nuevas soluciones para demandas futuras.  Bases de Datos : Administración (con sólido criterio técnico) de las diversas Bases de Datos (actualmente usan 3, gestionadas por Google. Será su responsabilidad proponer las estructuras y algoritmos óptimos para cada problema. oBigQuery: Almacenamiento masivo de datos (provenientes de los dispositivos IoT) y capacidad para queries masivas con objetivos analíticos.  oDatastore: Solución NoSQL de Google, de la que bebe el servicio de App Engine, donde se aloja la aplicación web.  oPostgreSQL: Almacenamiento de información usuarios y sus respectivos permisos.  Tareas de Procesamiento : El grueso de los servicios de la compañía está concentrado en Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), por lo que las diversas tareas de transformación de los datos del cliente deberán ser desplegadas, casi siempre, en GKE.  REQUISITOS  Experiencia : Al menos 5 años de experiencia en el diseño de bases de datos (SQL / NoSQL), análisis y diseño de algoritmos, así como estructuras de datos. Haber trabajado con extracción de datos en Streaming (con Apache Beam/ Google Cloud Dataflow idealmente, pero si no Apache Flink o Spark Streaming) y SCADA, FTP o bases de datos relacionales. Competencias  y c onocimientos técnicos : Imprescindible Python, y se valora como un plus el conocimiento de Java o JavaScript, empleando las tecnologías de Big Data más importantes (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, …). Debe haber trabajado con Docker y/o algún orquestador, preferiblemente Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). Experiencia en Cloud, se valorará haber trabajado con Google Cloud Platform – GCP (BigQuery, Datastore, Google Cloud Dataflow, GKE y Google Cloud PubSub). Educación : Imprescindible formación técnica: Física, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o similares (necesitará profundos conocimientos de algoritmia y estructuras de datos) y se valorarán sus conocimientos sobre Ingeniería de Sistemas (Gestión de redes y sistemas de información). Habilidades interpersonales : Una persona con una amplia capacidad técnica curiosa, proactiva, con capacidad de crítica y con disposición para proponer mejoras. Responsable, organizada, acostumbrada a trabajar bajo metodología Agile (Scrum).  ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?  Acerca de la compañía y el Plan de carrera : Posición relevante en una compañía disruptiva, con mentalidad start-up, el respaldo de una gran multinacional energética y en fase de crecimiento. Trabajarás con tecnologías punteras (Inteligencia Artificial, Machine Learning, Big Data, IoT, Open Source, Cloud…) en proyectos core para clientes nacionales e internacionales que permiten optimizar la calidad del servicio, del negocio y de los procesos basando la toma de decisiones en datos. Cultura de puertas abiertas, entorno agile e innovador, flexibilidad, autonomía y libertad para proponer, investigar, y ¡mejorar! Condiciones y Localización : Atractiva remuneración. Horario flexible. Madrid – España. Proceso de selección: Agile: dos fases. Incorporación Inmediata.  ¿MOTIVADO? INSCRÍBETE AHORA  Visita nuestra página web e inscríbete en esta oferta a través de ““  Para ampliar información acerca de esta posición, contacta con el equipo de GT Linkers, en concreto con:  GT Linkers es una boutique de selección y head-hunting internacional y ofrece igualdad de oportunidades a todos los solicitantes de empleo, que serán considerados para el empleo sin distinción de raza, nacionalidad, religión, género, orientación sexual, discapacidad, edad, estado civil o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley aplicable.

Visualize the information in QlikSense   Experience with Hadoop ecosystem(HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hive, Hue) and Amazon Web Services preferred.  Team worker while open to remote working Qualifications   Mandatory skills:  Spark, Python, SQL  Strong Data modeling and Analytics  QlikSense Qualifications  7+ years of related work experience. Degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred.   At least 5 years experience in data processing roles such as data engineer, database developer/administrator, ETL developer, data analyst, BI analytics developer  +5 years working in Commertial Pharma Analytics and data modeling role.  +5 years of experience with QlikSense   Exposure to Palantir Foundry platform or other data management platforms preferred  Travel No  Job Type Experienced  Schedule Full-time  Job Level Code IC  Equal Employment Opportunity At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Title: R1 First Stage Researcher Position
Description: Offer Description   Publish date October 20th 2020   NºRef. 45/2020   Code: Combenergy    Project: COMBINING ENERGY SOURCES TO ENHANCE CATALYTIC PROCESSES IN THE ENERGY AREA    Area: Advanced Materials for Energy    Area leader: Prof. Joan Ramon Morante    Group: Functional Nanomaterials Group    Group leader: Prof. ICREA Andreu Cabot   The Functional Nanomaterials Group in the Advanced Materials for Energy Area of IREC announces a PhD student position available for a highly motivated candidate to work in the Combenery Project: COMBINING ENERGY SOURCES TO ENHANCE CATALYTIC PROCESSES IN THE ENERGY AREA   R1 First Stage Researcher Position   The Functional Nanomaterials Group in the Advanced Materials for Energy Area of IREC announces a PhD student position available for a highly motivated candidate to work in the Combenery Project: COMBINING ENERGY SOURCES TO ENHANCE CATALYTIC PROCESSES IN THE ENERGY AREA.  COMBENERGY will explore combinations of thermal energy with light and electricity, aiming at identifying scenarios where a strong synergy between energy sources is reached. The combination of these energy sources in industrial catalytic processes is relatively unexplored and a large controversy/ignorance on the energy efficiency and technological potential, i.e. cost-effectiveness, of these strategies exist. Within this project, we will not consider the case of photo-electrocatalysis, which is being extensively studied by other groups. We will also not consider the more complex triple combination of energy sources, thermo-photo-electro, which will be considered in a future extension of the project. To validate reliably our strategy, we will explore three paradigmatic catalytic processes and several catalytic formulations. Besides, consistently with the project motivation, we will aim at using solar energy as the source of heat and/or light.  Candidates must have a bachelor degree in Chemistry, Physics, Material Science or equivalent. Candidates must also have a master degree or finish it before July 2021. Previous experience in nanoparticle synthesis and characterization, and/or in the field of catalysis will very valuable for the position.  Additional Information  CV, personal references and a motivation letter have to be sent to Dr. Andreu Cabot ( click apply ).  Deadline for applications: November 25th 2020, 12:00 AM (Spanish local time)  Incorporation: June 2021  Duration of the contract: 3 years through FPI fellowship  Gross salary: 17.774,33 Euros/year  The recruitment process will follow the guidelines of the European Charter of Researchers. Further information can be directly obtained from: Andreu Cabot ( click apply ).
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Energía renovable y medio ambiente, Enseñanza superior, Investigación

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: About Us  At Openbank, we are a relentlessly client-focused group that are re-engineering the way banks work with data. We are looking for passionate and creative people who love Machine Learning and Amazon Web Services to join our team. We get off on solving real problems in the simplest, most elegant manner possible. At Openbank, we're a team but also a family. We dream big, iterate fast, and build things.  About You  You are a motivated and energetic Machine Learning Engineer who can be an innovation catalyst in our organization ready to pioneer the next generation of Machine Learning solutions. You should be goal-orientated and be able to work without any supervision or mentorship. You thrive in a cross-functional setting.  Key Responsibilities  You know how to design, develop and apply machine learning models. In the past, you have improved processes by making data-driven decisions. You know how to choose the right metric o measure the performance and possible winnings of your model. You design your solution in a scalable and production-readiness manner. You should be goal-orientated and be able to work without any supervision or mentorship. You know how to identify that specific field which could be speeded up or at least improve by using ML.  Qualifications   Machine learning:  you know the difference between a Random Forest and a Neural Network and you know how to implement them. Excellent Python skills. This includes every of the well-known ML frameworks.  Software development:  you have used git and you know what 'Agile' means. You know how to work with Sagemaker and you have experience with AWS. Big Data skills (mainly Spark and Hive) are so well received. Deep Learning including NLP is a plus.

Title: Data Engineer Madrid
Description: Job Description  About AccentureAccenture is a leading global  professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation. About Supply Chain and Operations Applied IntelligencePart of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships. The Barcelona Innovation Centerhas been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance. Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs. Data Engineer roleIntroductionYou will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.Your role  To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise  Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution  Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations  Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.  A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworksKey Responsibilities  Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.  Design the integration with legacy data sources.  Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.  Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.  Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy. Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.  Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality  Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals  Build high-performance algorithms,  Prototypes, And Proof Of ConceptsQualifications Skills  you will need Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP. SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB Other database tools, e.g. SCADA Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred) Unix and Unix-like systems Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA. Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software

Title: Data Engineer
Description: As a Data Engineer, you will interact with data scientists, big data architects, software developers, and business experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded, processed and presented for LIDL analytics products. You will contribute to the design, development, testing, deployment, performance in production and maintenance of the data-centric software including APIs, libraries, toolbox… Core activities: Development to industrialize the following workflow: Data Backend Development (ETLs, APIs and Data Preparation) Algorithms Development (Data Mining and Machine Learning) BI Development (SQL, ETLs, Datawarehouse) Technical and professional skills: Development: Languages (appreciated): .NET, Java Experience in Agile methodology As a bonus, knowledge of Machine Learning (Scikit-Learn, R, Spark ML...) Soft skills and competencies: Passion for learning new tools, languages and frameworks Ability to be creative and innovation-minded, self-motivated and proactive. Fast adaptation to changing requirements and strong problem-solving skills. To work in a collaborative model, side by side with the business Fluency in English to work in a multi-cultural environment Experience: MS’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field 4+ years’ experience in software development 2+ years’ experience in Big Data Frameworks As a bonus, contribution to open source projects About us Who we are SCRM, Lidl’s international digital HUB, was created in Nov 2015 as an external company to manage the organizational challenge required in such a transformation towards a customer-oriented model that incorporates data into the decision-making process and digitalization with the latest technologies. The Hub is a multidisciplinary team (Creativity, Business Analyst, Designers, UX, data Engineers, Developers, etc.) with direct contact with the Lidl board, that works by Squads with an Agile working methodology. Right now, we have almost 100 passionate SCRMs working in our Hub. What we offer Office located in the city center, right in Plaza Catalunya Possibility of working in one of the top 10 IT hubs in BCN Possibility of improving your skills by working with some of the best IT professionals in BCN 23 days of holiday + your birthday Reduced working hours in August: 9-15h and every Friday of the year. Free water, fresh fruits, tea and coffee (Nespresso, what else?) Full medical insurance cover Ticket Restaurant for 170€ / month Life and disability insurance Optional: DIR Gym Corporate deal (93% subsidised by the company) Tax free benefit for transport and kindergarden. Language courses: English, German and Spanish Join the challenge! SCRM provides equal employment opportunities to any job applicant or employee and confirms that it is committed to ensuring that there shall be no direct or indirect discrimination against, or harassment of, job applicants or employees on grounds of race, creed, colour, ethnic origin, nationality, gender, gender reassignment or transsexualism, religious or other similar beliefs, age, marital or family status, sexual orientation, or disability. SCRM recruits, hires, promotes, transfers, takes disciplinary action, and makes all personnel decisions, including those related to compensation and benefits, in a non-discriminatory manner and in accordance with applicable laws. We hereby inform you that SOCIAL BIGDATA COMUNICACIÓN, S.L.U. (hereinafter “SCRM” or “we”) located at calle Bergara 13, 4ª, 08002 Barcelona, Spain, with telephone number +34 937076017 is the data controller responsible for protecting personal information you provide to us in your cv directly within the recruitment process or which we may receive from job and recruiting sites and/or headhunters. Moreover, SCRM will process any additional data that may be submitted or updated during the recruitment process. Your personal data is absolutely essential to participate. We do not collect any special category data. Please kindly do not provide us with such data. SCRM process your personal data based on your consent and to manage, develop and follow up on the recruitment processes that suits your profile. Your personal data will not be transferred to third parties unless it is required by law. However, we may communicate your personal data to the suppliers of services which we may contract, and which have the status of data processor. Your personal data will be kept until your consent is withdrawn and in any case for a maximum period of one year from the finalization of the recruitment process. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, cancellation, opposition, restricted processing and data portability with regard to your data at any time. To this effect you may contact the Data Protection Officer appointed by SCRM by sending a letter to the abovementioned postal address or per email to: ********** . Additionally, you have the right to file a complaint to the Spanish Data Protection Agency if you consider that any of your rights have been infringed.

Title: Data Engineer
Description: As Google Cloud's premier partner in AI, we provide world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud.  We help clients take leading technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. With Google Cloud Platform as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.  Our team consists of experts in machine learning, data science, software engineering, mathematics, and design. We share a passion for data & analysis, operate at the cutting edge, and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving hard problems.  As a Data Engineer you will work with colleagues on the data engineering and architecture part of our consulting projects, building robust pipelines and wrangling data in a way that it becomes easy to visualise and ready to be fed into our machine learning models. In addition to that, you will be helping us to build out the data engineering side of our next-generation machine learning products.  Furthermore, You Will   Work with the most innovative and most scalable data processing technologies   Build innovative state-of-the-art solutions with our customers   Work closely with our tech partners: Google Cloud Platform, Tableau, Looker   Work in an agile and dynamic environment together with a small team with our data scientists, machine learning experts, data analysts and data engineers    Requirements   Strong programming and architectural experience, ideally in Python and/or Java, and SQL  2+ years of experience building (big) data solutions   Extremely passionate about data and analytics   Experience with ETL tools, Hadoop-based technologies (e.g. Spark) and/or data pipelines (e.g. Beam, Flink)  Experience building scalable and high-performant code   Experience in producing tested, resilient and well documented applications    The ability to take ownership, end-to-end and finding creative solutions   Experience in architecting, building, maintaining and troubleshooting cloud infrastructure   Excellent interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills: a team player and keen learner who loves building great things together   Working experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Amazon Web Services (AWS)   BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science or a related technical field   Professional working proficiency in English    Bonus Points   Love for the command line with optional affinity for Linux scripting   Experience building scalable REST APIs using Python or similar technologies   Experience with Agile methodologies such as Scrum   Basic knowledge of and ideally some experience with data science topics like machine learning, data mining, statistics, and visualisation    Contributions to open source projects    Benefits   The Basics  : 25 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, choice of laptop & pension scheme   Learning  : Datatonic encourages continuous learning at all levels with a generous conference budget, freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies as well as regular knowledge-sharing activities   Career Development:  A personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression   Impact  : The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and ML solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations   Innovation  : Access to Datatonic LABs, our Research & Development hub. Experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!   Team Vibe & Social:  A welcoming and friendly team plus regular monthly social events and team offsites (or remote events)  Working for Datatonic  Our Core Values Are  We’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. We have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. As a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development.   Cultivating Excellence   A hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.   Owning It   Working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. We love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.   Purposeful Impact   Creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.   Winning with Partners & Friends   Our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. It’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.   Note to candidates - This is an English-speaking role. Please upload your CVs in English.
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Internet

Title: Python Data Engineer - Málaga
Description: Role Purpose  Job Description  To write, debug, maintain and test our products (existing ones, new modules on existing applications or completely new products). Work with other stakeholders (senior developers, dev managers and technical leads, analysis, test, project management, product owners) to complete the work on the agreed timelines and with the required quality.  Main Responsabilities Designs and build component-based applications in a web/internet delivery environment, alone or with other developers I or II. Works on new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Scopes, implements, tests and deploys new features and versions of core applications, databases and utilities. Performs hands-on coding and assists in the design of solutions. Raises issues during the development cycle (running late, blockers, lack of analysis, etc.) Prepares reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software when asked by his/her managers. Provides documentation of user's requirements, development of user stories, and estimates when requested to do so. Assists with providing third-level support to business users. Helps with code reviews. Writes design technical documents. Participates actively in reviews and technical design meetings and provide valuable feedback. Follows company policies regarding development. Mentors Software Developer Engineers I. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Participates actively in planning meetings, retrospectives, daily stand-ups, and other meetings as part of the software development process. Updates progress in our systems (i.e. move items to the right status, remaining effort, etc.). Learns from senior team members regarding proper application design and security. Any other duties commensurate to the grade of the role.   Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred in Computer Science or other relevant field and demonstrable related experience. Working knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle. Expert in object-oriented programming concepts, unit & integration testing, data and relational databases, technical database design, web architecture and application servers. Strong ability to document development including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications. Knowledge of Agile development methodologies helpful. Strong skills of design patterns. Deep understanding of performance and scalability implications in the development process and experience with performance monitoring tools. Ability to install complex software patches and upgrades. Ability to review code written by others and provide feedback and recommendations to follow coding guidelines. Able to provide estimates. Demonstrated ability to write technical documents including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Be able to design considering operational costs. Desire to lead a workstream coordinating a small team of developers. Ability to do a risk analysis. Independently productive being able to face most tasks on their own and understand when they need to ask for help.   Tech Stack  Languages Backend - Python 3.x, SQL  OS – Linux, Windows  IDE – VSCode  CLI – Git  VCS - Bitbucket  DBaaS - Snowflake  AWS Services (S3, EC2, Batch, Athena, Lambda, ...)  JupyterHub  Pentaho  CI/CD – Bamboo, Sonar  Project Management - JIRA  Additional Information  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Consumer Privacy Notice
