Title: Research Scientist, Molecular Interactions
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb’s research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, creative and collaborative Computational Research Scientist, Molecular Interactions to join a multi-disciplinary team to:  Contribute in both technical and scientific aspects at the interface between biology, chemistry and machine learning. Work to understand and further apply the revolutionary mechanisms of action of novel chemical matter for targeted protein degradation, such as molecular glue and heterobifunctional degraders (aka PROTACs) of enormous therapeutic potential. Innovate through the application, development and integration of computational chemistry state-of-the-art methods and machine learning to leverage orthogonal information sources with a strong emphasis on interpretability at the structural and molecular level. Actively collaborate with scientific teams of different backgrounds and locations. Creatively identify opportunities to apply or develop computational methods that contribute to the data-driven understanding of mechanisms of action and indications.  Requirements  PhD in a relevant discipline, such as computational chemistry, cheminformatics, biophysics or related fields, accompanied by original research publications. Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Python, C++ or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. MAESTRO, KNIME, RDKit or similar). Attention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds. Verbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Recursos humanos, Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria

Title: Network Researcher
Description: i2Cat Foundation's Scientific group, managed by an ICREA/i2CAT Research Professor, is looking for two talented researchers with a strong background in the field of mobile networks and experience in applied AI. The Scientific group is focused on basic and fundamental R&D activities on new challenging concepts, such as network/RAN virtualization, network programmability, network slicing, mmwave, smart surfaces, etc. with a particular interest on their applications towards the society digital transformation. Expected 6G use cases, such as AI-based automation of mobile networks, mission-critical communications and wireless sensing, will be carefully evaluated and corresponding solutions will be designed and implemented in our lab premises.  The work focuses on the analytical evaluation of solutions designed as well as proof of concepts both for public and industrial R&D projects in collaboration with industrial and academic partners.  Work objectives are concept studies and evaluation, research prototype software development, publications as well as IPR creation. The research work will be carried out in an international team of researchers.  Who We Are  i2CAT Foundation is a non-profit research and innovation centre that promotes mission oriented R&D activities on advanced Internet architectures, applications and services. The centre stands for a new open innovation framework, fostering the collaboration between companies, public administration, the academic environment and end-users.  i2CAT’s activities span the areas of Research, playing a key role in the EU Framework Program for Research and Innovation: Strategic Projects, leading local initiatives that strengthen the digital policies of public administration, and Technology Transfer, fostering R&D collaboration with companies to develop innovative market-oriented solutions.  Want to know more? Visit our webpage!  What Do We Offer You will be part of a multicultural team. We have a fun loving and friendly international work environment.Be in contact and work with cutting-edge technologyWork in challenging R&D projectsA full-time fixed term, of initial duration of 3 years. The contract may be extended till the end of the projectFix + variable salaryOption of flexible retribution (restaurant card, transport card, medical insurance, kindergarten)Flexible working schedule - We know you have a life outside of work and we will work with you to make sure it's kept that wayFridays afternoon offIntensive work schedule in July & AugustHome-office optionOpen space office in BarcelonaFree fruit every weekDiscounted Gym-access25 vacation days per yearCasual dress codeLet us know which trainings you needYou will have the opportunity to attend tech conferences and events. The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and, therefore explicitly, encourages women to apply.  The i2CAT Foundation seeks to increase the number of persons with disabilities among its workforce, and therefore explicitly encourages this collective to apply.  Applications Should Include Cover letter stating the motivation and suitability of the candidate  Minimum Requirements PhD degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or Computer ScienceResearch publications in top venuesExcellent academic record5G network architecture and protocolsArtificial Intelligence basicsData Science basicsNetwork virtualization conceptsNetwork programmabilityOperational networks traces analysisNetwork optimization modelsPrototyping for PoC demonstrationsSoftware development under UNIX-based system (Linux, FreeBSD etc.)  Desired Requirements Participation in EU funded research projectsInternational experience as a postdoc researcherExperience with AI frameworks, e.g. pytorch ...Practical experience with commercial network equipment Access points, base stations, switches, EPC, ...Software-defined Radio (SDR) such as FPGA (e.g., NI USRP), mmwave COTSmmwave networksWireless SensingIPR generation experience-Teaching

Title: Junior Researcher in Sensor Technology (gas sensors)
Description: We offer one position for a student/junior researcher in electronic sensor technology.  The core idea of this project is to produce an ultra-low power gas sensor based on microLED technology, suitable for remote environmental monitoring and autonomous operation (energy harvesting, wireless communications). The development combines semiconductor microtechnology (blue GaN LEDs), sensor material processing (metal oxides) and accurate device test.  The person will be dedicated to  Device fabrication  Electronic test of devices and sensor calibration.  Integration of devices in IoT systems. Some experience in applied research is expected, laboratory work, electronic instruments, materials characterization.  Possibility to carry out a PhD related to this work.  Project duration: 3 years + 1 year of possible extension. Title: Business Analyst
Description: Por qué deberías considerar esta oportunidad  Santander Global Tech (SGT) está buscando un BUSINESS ANALYST para nuestras oficinas en los HEADQUARTERS.  ¿Te gustaría ser parte de una de las mayores transformaciones que el mundo está experimentando en las últimas décadas? En el sector financiero, las expectativas y los comportamientos de los consumidores están cambiando de manera acelerada: en paralelo, los avances tecnológicos están permitiendo mejorar la experiencia de los clientes y crear nuevas plataformas y negocios que antes eran impensables.  Santander Global Tech (SGT) somos parte del equipo global de Tecnología y Operaciones del Santander, uno de los grupos bancarios más importantes en Europa y América, contribuyendo a su éxito día a día. Nuestro equipo lo formamos más de 2.000 de personas en 7 países (España, Portugal, Reino Unido, Estados Unidos, México, Chile y Brasil), desarrollando y/o implantando soluciones financieras en un amplio espectro de tecnologías (Blockchain, Big Data o Angular entre otras) sobre todo tipo de plataformas, on-premise y Cloud. Somos motor de la transformación digital del Santander y estamos convencidos de la importancia que la tecnología esté alineada a las necesidades de negocio y de que nuestro trabajo aporte valor a los usuarios, personas y comunidades, así como que fomente la creatividad de las personas.  Nuestra misión es contribuir para ayudar al progreso de las personas y los negocios. Mejor que contarlo con palabras, puedes hacer click en este enlace por qué Santander y acceder a un vídeo en el que contamos por qué la banca puede ser una extraordinaria opción profesional para desarrollarte.  Santander se enorgullece de ser una organización donde hay igualdad de oportunidades, independientemente de raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género.  Qué harás en tu trabajo  Tus funciones serán las requeridas para un Data Scientist.  Necesitamos a alguien como tú para que nos ayude en distintos ámbitos:  Elaborar requerimientos técnicos y funcionales, basados en el las necesidades de los negocios y en el plan estratégico y de operaciones de la Organización, Resolución de dudas y la toma de decisiones en los planes de negocio  Gestión del backlog:  refinamiento, detalle, estimación, inclusión de nuevas peticiones, priorización, decisión acerca de qué peticiones se deben incluir. Técnicas de priorización de requisitos para poder focalizar los esfuerzos del equipo en aquellos ítems o requisitos que aporten mayor valor al negocio. Qué buscamos  EXPERIENCIA  Requerido  Más de tres años en funciones anteriormente descritas o similares.  EDUCACIÓN  Requerido  Licenciatura o grado superior (Económicas, Matemáticas, Ingenieros, etc  Deseable  Certificación, máster, post-grado o curso de formación técnica en Data  HABILIDADES & CONOCIMIENTOS  Requerido  Conocimientos En  ETL, reporting, dashbording, gestión de proyectos agile, etc.  Nuevas Tecnologías  APIs  Testing  Big Data  Qué ofrecemos  Estos Son Los Factores Clave Que Multiplican Las Acciones De Todos Nuestros Empleados  Bienvenido al #TheSantanderEffect. En Santander solo con una pequeña acción o una idea sencilla, puedes hacer grandes cosas. Te ofrecemos las ventajas y los medios para contribuir al progreso de más de 140 millones de personas en el mundo.  Impacto significativo – Donde el efecto de tu trabajo marca la diferencia y ayuda a las personas y a los negocios a prosperar. Crecimiento personal y profesional – Oportunidad de desarrollarte con formación a nivel mundial, trabajo retador y roles distintos. Respeto – Ser parte de una organización que se preocupa – por las personas, por su amplia comunidad, y por el medioambiente. Compañeros de trabajo de calidad – Trabajar con profesionales inspiradores que son líderes en su campo. Estabilidad global – Trabajar para una sólida organización que se ha reinventado satisfactoriamente en varias ocasiones a lo largo de sus 160 años de historia.  Si quieres conocer más sobre nosotros, síguenos en LinkedIn o Instagram.

Description: Oferta de trabajo: Statistician/Data Scientist for the Health Impact Assessment group Statistician/Data Scientist for the Health Impact Assessment groupOferta de trabajoISGLOBAL Este sitio web utiliza cookies propias y de terceros para obtener información de sus hábitos de búsqueda e intentar mejorar la calidad de nuestros servicios y de la navegación por nuestro sitio web. Más información .Ofertas de trabajoPrensaContacto Es COVID-19: Haz un donativoSobre ISGlobalQuiénes somosEquipoDónde actuamosTrabaja con nosotrosContactoInvestigaciónIniciativasAnálisis y DesarrolloFormaciónActualidad Sobre ISGlobal Trabaja con nosotros Ofertas de trabajo Oferta de trabajo: Statistician/Data Scientist for the Health Impact Assessment group ComparteCompartir en FacebookCompartir en TwitterCompartir en LinkedInCompartir por email Descripción The Barcelona Institute for Global Health, ISGlobal, is the fruit of an innovative alliance between academic, government, and philanthropic institutions to contribute to the efforts undertaken by the international community to address the challenges in global health, through research, translation to policy and education. ISGlobal has a broad portfolio in communicable and non-communicable diseases including environmental and climate determinants, and applies a multidisciplinary scientific approach ranging from the molecular to the population level. Research is organized in three main areas, Malaria and other Infectious Diseases, Child and Maternal Health, and Urban Health, Climate & Non-Communicable Diseases. ISGlobal is the first global public health centre to have received the Severo Ochoa distinction, a seal of excellence of the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation. Lugar BarcelonaCampus Mar What We Are Looking for We are recruiting a statistician or data scientist to join our dynamic team. The statistician will be involved in exciting projects related to Health Impact Assessment (HIA) of large-scale public interventions to improve the health of populations in High and Low-Middle Income countries. The overarching aim of the HIA group at ISGlobal is to develop quantitative HIA as a cross-disciplinary activity, working with the three internationally recognized areas of the institute: 1) malaria and other infectious diseases, 2) maternal and child health, and 3) urban health, climate and non-communicable diseases. The position will involve statistical analysis of data from different sources, application of regression models commonly used in epidemiology, and analyses with user-friendly microsimulation software. The role requires close collaboration with international project partners from a range of disciplines as well as researchers at ISGlobal. The successful applicant will be supervised by the HIA Group Leader, Dr Davide Rasella, Associate Research Professor. Key ResponsibilitiesPerform statistical analyses and simulations for the projects of the HIA team.Provide statistical support to its researchers.Creation and management of datasets. CompetencesKnowledge of applied and theoretical statistics.Programming using the main statistical tools and software in R or STATA.High level of critical thinking skills and ability to work independently.Good communication skills both written and spoken. Training and experienceBachelor`s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics or related fields. Language levelGood level of English (written and spoken). How to apply Applicants must fill in the request form including the following reference: Statistician/DataScientist_HealthImpactAssessment_Sep20 and attach the CV and a Cover Letter. Each attached document must be named with the candidate name and surname. The receipt of applications will be open until 7th October. Applications will be accepted until 17.00 CET of the closing date. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. This position will be co-funded through the “Centro de Excelencia Severo Ochoa 2019-2023” Program (CEX 2018-000806-S) from the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation. Please contact ********** for questions about this position. Title: RESEARCHER TECNOSPRING SUSTAINABLE INDUSTRY (WATER)
Description: WATER QUALITY MODELLING OF DISINFECTION BY -PRODUCTS IN DRINKING WATER NETWORKS.  EURECAT, Centre Tecnològic de Catalunya is a non-profit private foundation whose aim is to improve the technological competitiveness and sustainability of companies through R+D+i projects and specialized services. Eurecat is currently the leading Technology Centre in Catalonia, and the second largest private research organization in Southern Europe. Eurecat manages a turnover of 50M€ and 650 professionals, is involved in more than 160 R&D projects and has a customer portfolio of over companies. Eurecat R&D, innovation and training activities is distributed in four main areas of knowledge: Industrial, Sustainability, Biotech and Digital. Additionally, Eurecat has been accepted by the European Commission as a KETs (Key Enabling Technologies) Technology Centre to collaborate with SMEs on close-to-market research and innovation activities. The Sustainability Area has a broad expertise on the water sector (drinking water, wastewater, reclaimed water, groundwater) mainly in treatment and management. Eurecat has very-well equipped laboratories for the performance of lab, bench and pilot experiments and for the monitoring of chemical and biological parameters. Candidate will be integrated with a very skilled and dynamic team of more than 30 researchers, most of them doctors within the Water, Air and Soil Unit and will have the possibility to work in close collaboration with researchers from other units in Eurecat (digital, biotech, etc.).  Location of the vacancy: Manresa (Barcelona \/ Spain).

With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth – for both our customers and our team. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. Title: R1 First Stage Researcher Position
Description: Position  The Functional Nanomaterials Group in the Advanced Materials for Energy Area of IREC announces a PhD student position available for a highly motivated candidate to work in the Combenery Project: COMBINING ENERGY SOURCES TO ENHANCE CATALYTIC PROCESSES IN THE ENERGY AREA.  COMBENERGY will explore combinations of thermal energy with light and electricity, aiming at identifying scenarios where a strong synergy between energy sources is reached. The combination of these energy sources in industrial catalytic processes is relatively unexplored and a large controversy/ignorance on the energy efficiency and technological potential, cost-effectiveness, of these strategies exist. Within this project, we will not consider the case of photo-electrocatalysis, which is being extensively studied by other groups. We will also not consider the more complex triple combination of energy sources, thermo-photo-electro, which will be considered in a future extension of the project. To validate reliably our strategy, we will explore three paradigmatic catalytic processes and several catalytic formulations. Besides, consistently with the project motivation, we will aim at using solar energy as the source of heat and/or light.  Candidates must have a bachelor degree in Chemistry, Physics, Material Science or equivalent. Candidates must also have a master degree or finish it before July 2021. Previous experience in nanoparticle synthesis and characterization, and/or in the field of catalysis will very valuable for the position.  Additional Information  CV, personal references and a motivation letter have to be sent to Dr. Andreu Cabot ().  Deadline for applications: November 25th 2020, 12:00 AM (Spanish local time)  Incorporation: June 2021  Duration of the contract: 3 years through FPI fellowship  Gross salary: Euros/year  The recruitment process will follow the guidelines of the European Charter of Researchers. Further information can be directly obtained from: Andreu Cabot (

Title: Senior research scientist
Description: Offer Description  We seek candidates to apply for a research position in the competitive call Tecniospring INDUSTRY, a Marie Sklodowska-Curie Actions (COFUND) - H2020, funded by the European Commission and the Catalan Government.  PROJECT OFFER: TECHNOLOGICAL IMPACTS OF PRODUCING MILK FROM COWS WITH DIFFERENT BETA-CASEIN GENOTYPES  CN is the major protein group of milk, followed by whey proteins, where it is organized as micelles and submicelles, and shows 4 types (αs1, αs2, β and κ). From these CN types, the β-CN accounts for more than 1/3 total CN in cow’s milk and is especially important because of its impact on the technological and digestive properties. Fermentation and gastrointestinal digestion of milk proteins yield bioactive peptides. Several studies claimed that consumption of A2 β-CN is associated with lower prevalence of type 1 diabetes, lower mortality rates from ischemic heart disease and reduction of the intolerance and gastrointestinal discomfort of intolerant consumers to cow’s milk. For this reason, A2 milk has begun to be selected on farms and even sold. However, protein polymorphisms determine the suitability of cow’s milk for transformation in the dairy industry.   This project aims to investigate the effect of different β-casein genotypes (A2A2, A1A2, A1A1) in technological milk properties, products (high pasteurization and UHT milks) and their transformation (fresh cheese and yogurt).
Industries: Lácteos, Investigación, Producción alimentaria

Title: Research Scientist, Target Identification
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision - transforming patients' lives through science.In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease - and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry - each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, creative and collaborative Research Scientist, Target Identification to join a multi-disciplinary team to: Develop and apply computational methods to mine large-scale datasets of molecular profiles of cancer and other disease areas. These profiles include genomic and transcriptomic data, but also involve epigenetic regulation, phenotypic (CRISPR) screens and single-cell measurementsIntegrate public and internal data, comparing and complementing different layers of evidence to reach sound and meaningful biological conclusionsContribute to the identification of novel therapies through elucidation of disease and therapeutic mechanismsCollaborate with experimental teams on iterative validation of therapeutic and mechanistic hypotheses  Requirements PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).Experience analyzing high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etcExperience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageousAttention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.Verbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description: About Glovo:We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.Your work-life opportunity:We are looking for talented and passionate Senior Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team in our Barcelona HQ.Glovo has a culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands data that is timely, accurate, and actionable. We grow really fast collecting Terabytes of data from tens of data sources and providing interfaces for our internal customers to access and query the data hundreds of thousands of times per day. As a Senior Data Engineer you will be designing, building and constantly improving Glovo’s reliable and scalable Big Data Platform using technologies like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Spark, Python and many more. Joining us your work will have an immediate influence on the shape of data consumed by teams across Glovo including Central BI, Data Scientists and Business Analysts. Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for itself having helped deliver on data platform wide projects that have had significant impact. You have developed complex, scalable and well designed data pipelines and defined engineering standards which have helped different data teams achieve efficiency while providing mentoring and technical leadership where necessary. You will be at times working independently and at other times within a team to achieve a given goal. Others respect you and you are a sought out Data Engineer because of your expertise and depth of knowledge.Be a part of a team where you will:Design, implement and keep improving Glovo Data PlatformBuild scalable data pipelines using different technologiesParticipate in the development of Data Lake, Data Warehouse, different methods of data ingestion and Self Service ETL tools using best architectural practices.Mentor & share technical expertise with data engineers, data scientists, BI analysts and other technology colleaguesBe on top of new technologies and industry trendsYou have:5+ years of software/data engineering experience3+ years experience in Python and SparkProfessional experience building complex ETLs/data pipelinesWorking experience with Amazon Web Services / Google Cloud PlatformExperience with task orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi)Cloud Data Warehousing experience in Redshift or another distributed platform (e.g. Hadoop + Hive/Presto, BigQuery or Snowflake)Experience in Data Streaming (Spark, Flume, Kafka, Kinesis, Flink, etc.)Import and transform data from many third-party APIsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsVery good EnglishNice to have:Experience working with AWS EMR, AWS Glue, DatabricksExperience with Docker, KubernetesExperience in building Data LakeOrchestration of Machine Learning pipelinesExperience our Glovo Life benefits:Enticing Phantom Shares planAttractive Relocation packageComprehensive Private Health InsuranceCobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and foodFree monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!Discounted Gym membershipsFlexible working environmentWhat you’ll find when working at Glovo:Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia. Title: Research Scientist, Computational Biology Methods
Description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision - transforming patients' lives through science.In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease - and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry - each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, creative and collaborative Research Scientist, Computational Biology Methods to join a multi-disciplinary team to: Develop and apply innovative computational approaches to gain insights from complex and multidimensional large-scale biological datasets in cancer and other disease areas.Identify and adapt optimal analysis methods for studies into target identification, elucidation of mechanisms, patient selection and patient stratificationImplement statistical frameworks for e.g. integrative analysis of varied data, network-based inference, interrogating single cell dataApply the methods to inform the clinical development of pipeline compounds and the discovery of novel therapies  Requirements PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).Advanced mathematical and statistical skills. Machine learning expertise a plus.Familiarity with methods for high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etcExperience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageousAttention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.Verbal and written English language fluency.  Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.  The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. Title: Early Stage Researcher (ESR 5) in Terahertz Photonics (Madrid- SPAIN); MSCA-ITN - TERAOPTICS... - Leganés
Description: Prof. Guillermo Carpintero, at Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, seeks for an early stage researcher (ESR) to join his group for research in the field of Terahertz Photonics in Leganés (Madrid), SPAIN.  The ESR fellowship will be provided within the framework of the European Marie Skłodowska-Curie Innovative Training Network (H2020-MSCA-ITN-2020) TERAOPTICS. TERAOPTICS is a consortium of 5 academic universities and 6 industrial partners as well as further 13 partner organizations, with an awarded budget of 4 million Euro. TERAOPTICS will recruit altogether 15 early stage research (ESR) fellows.  TERAOPTICS stands for a research consortium addressing “Terahertz Photonics for Communications, Space, Security, Radio-Astronomy, and Material Science”. TERAOPTICS will create a vibrant, interdisciplinary, intersectoral and international training-through-research environment. The consortium has the capacity to develop altogether 15 PhD projects.   Photonic integrated mode-locked devices for low phase noise signal sources   The key objective of this research project is to study and develop photonic integrated mode locked lasers as optical signal sources for frequency-stable and low-phase noise Terahertz signal generation for pumping SBD mixers. The vision of this research work is to develop a high repetition rate mode locked laser diode (MLLD) prototype using intracavity and extra-cavity structures that will provide a sub-harmonic continuous wave optical local oscillator signal required to generate high quality frequency stable and low phase noise THz signals.   General eligibility criteria  You will be employed as an early stage researcher according to Marie Skłodowska-Curie ITN regulations, which offers excellent employment conditions including a high base salary and many additional benefits, such as allowances for travel, mobility, and education.  In order to apply you must not have resided or carried out any main activity (work, studies, etc.) in SPAIN for more than 12 months in the last 3 years prior to your recruitment. You must also have less than 4 years of postgraduate research experience.  Specific Requirements For The Position  Completed MSc degree in the fields of photonics, electrical engineering or other related fields:  Excellent English language and English writing skills:  Good communication skills and ability to work in a multidisciplinary and international team. Benefits And Salary  The MSCA program offers highly competitive and attractive salary and working conditions. The successful candidate will receive a salary in accordance with the MSCA regulations for ESRs. Exact salary will be confirmed upon appointment.  Note: In addition to the individual scientific project, all fellows of the TERAOPTICS ITN will benefit from further continuing education, which includes secondments, a variety of training modules as well as transferable skills courses and active participation in workshops and conferences. The approximate gross salary stated above is subject to employer’s statutory deductions and the amount varies according to the living costs of the host country.   Further information and details for submitting a job application  To apply send your full CV (pdf-file) to Guillermo Carpintero (). Please, also contact at this email for further information.  Funding is provided for 36 months.  Equal opportunities in recruitment will be applied.  The recruitment process will include an interview (face-to-face or via video conference).
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Gestión de organizaciones sin ánimo de lucro, Enseñanza superior, Investigación

Title: RESEARCHER TECNOSPRING SUSTAINABLE INDUSTRY (SOIL)
Description: SUSTAINABLE REMEDIATION TECHNOLOGIES FOR POLLUTED SOIL OR GROUNDWATER.  EURECAT, is a non-profit private foundation whose aim is to improve the technological competitiveness and sustainability of companies through R+D+i projects and specialized services. Eurecat is currently the leading Technology Centre in Catalonia, and the second largest private research organization in S Europe. Eurecat manages a turnover of 50M€ and 650 professionals, is involved in more than 160 R&D projects and has a customer portfolio of over companies. Eurecat R&D and innovation activities are distributed in four main areas of knowledge: Industrial, Sustainability, Biotech and Digital. The Sustainability area aims at contributing to sustainable development through the enhancement of environmental quality in the fields of sustainability, water management, wastewater treatment, soils and groundwater reclamation and management. This area has high scientific equipment in their laboratories for the performance of lab, bench and pilot experiments and for chemical analysis, membrane testing, water treatment, microbiological analysis, and soil tests. The candidate will be integrated in the Water, Air and Soil (WAS) Unit, in a highly skilled and dynamic team of ca. 20 researchers. WAS has participated in numerous projects and individual contracts aimed at innovation, development, testing and optimization of soil and groundwater treatment technologies and techniques for both point-source and diffuse pollution. WAS has experience in the following processes: bioremediation, metals stabilization\/precipitation\/mobilization, stripping of volatile contaminants and chemical reduction with nanoparticles (nZVI). WAS has worked with several contaminants in groundwater and soil: TPHs, PAHs, nitrates, metals and chlorinated organic compounds. WAS has developed mycoremediation of polluted soils on mesocosms with biostimulation and bioaugmentation strategies.  Location: Manresa (Barcelona\/Spain).
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Investigación

Title: ROBOTICS RESEARCHER (COMPUTER VISION AND DEEP LEARNING)
Description: Job Description  The Robotics and Automation Unit of Eurecat Technology Center (Barcelona) is looking for a highly motivated researcher to work on Computer Vision and Deep Learning for industrial robotics and human-robot interaction.  The candidate shall work on different research projects dealing with robotic systems and sensors (mostly cameras). The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments in the Robotics Unit with a special focus on Computer Vision and Deep Learning as well as reports and project proposal elaboration. Other specializations will be considered depending on the applicant background and experience.  The main responsibilities will focus on the scientific contribution and technological developments in the perception line. Examples could be object detection and classification, relative pose estimation, perception on deformable objects, human tracking, etc.  These Are The Links Of Our Current And Previous Publicly Available Robotics Projects  What Eurecat can offer you The Robotics Group is specialized in research and development on Ground, Aerial and Industrial Robotics. With a strong focus on our customers and partners needs, our mission is to enhance the capabilities and reliability of autonomous systems operating in realistic scenarios, improving the existing technology and enabling new applications. For over 10 years, the group has been involved in several of the most successful European projects in robotics.  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/sharework\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/maf\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/ecofibra\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/icarus\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/aerial-robot-for-sewer-inspection\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/built2spec-2\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/nature4cities\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/geomove\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/grape\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/logimatic\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/maic\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/portfolio-items\/bots2rec\/  https:\/\/eurecat.org\/es\/portfolio-items\/mood2be\/  Check others in: https:\/\/eurecat.org\/en\/field-of-knowledge\/robotics-automation\/  Our laboratory is located in Cerdanyola del Vallès, in the outskirts of Barcelona city (Spain). Barcelona besides being easily connected to the rest of Europe, provides a great quality of life and a great robotics ecosystem full of initiatives, research groups, robotics companies and interesting events. And many more to come!

Title: Researcher in urban planning and computing - TecnioSpring programme
Description: Offer Description  Societat Orgànica , a professional cooperative that works in the field of sustainable building based in Barcelona, calls PhDs and expert researchers for a joint apply (researcher + project of common interest + company) to the international talent program TecnioSpring Industry .  In case of obtaining the program funding, it offers a 2-year employment contract to be developed in the company. According to TecnioSpring Industry conditions, candidates must be expert researchers of any nationality with: a PhD and two additional years of full-time research experience, or at least six years of full-time equivalent research experience (in any case this activity must be accredited). The modality chosen within the program is Incoming, therefore researchers must not have resided or carried out their main activity in the country of their host organisation for more than 12 months in 3 years immediately prior to the deadline for the submission of applications.  People with experience in urban planning, urban design and definition of outdoor spaces are sought. All this must be linked to modelling and analysis of sustainability using computer tools. Other expected capacities are: adaptation, autonomy, creativity, team collaboration, office and remote work, at least basic knowledge of Spanish, advanced English and availability to move to Barcelona on March 2021.  The person selected must draft, in collaboration to the company, a common interest project. It will be oriented towards the development of innovative consultancy services in parametric design and sustainability evaluation at urban, neighbourhood, group of buildings and outdoor spaces to be presented to TecnioSpring Industry (deadline 16 November 2020).

Title: Researcher - Alcohol Policy Research
Description: RESEARCH FIELD RESEARCHER PROFILE First Stage Researcher (R1) APPLICATION DEADLINE 10/11/2020 23:00 - Europe/Brussels LOCATION TYPE OF CONTRACT Temporary JOB STATUS Full-time HOURS PER WEEK 37,5 OFFER STARTING DATE 11/01/2021 OFFER DESCRIPTION The Center for Leadership at ESADE Business School is searching for a Post-doc or Master’s Graduate (including those with interest in pursuing a PhD), to join Alhambra, a project tendered by the European Commission (EC) to address 6 large inter-connected alcohol policy research areas with regards to European alcohol production, sales, consumption and policy responses. The candidate will join the research group in ESADE and the larger international research team of Alhambra. In Alhambra, ESADE is responsible for two distinct areas of work. The first aims to assess the alcohol impacts beyond the health sector, and highlight the centrality of Health in All Policies for addressing alcohol related harm, like considering health impacts in marketing, taxation, agriculture, education etc. This work will further unpack alcohol’s impact on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), looking into its negative economic and social consequences (e.g., loss of earnings, unemployment, family problems, violence, crime, stigma, barriers to healthcare, as well as the broader environment, biodiversity, water and food resources, climate, cities, etc.). Unravelling the interrelations between alcohol and the SDGs, its positive and negative impacts and related socio-economic externalities, and how this links to non-health policies will inform the development of a compelling case for: Alcohol In All relevant Policies. A second area of work addresses workplace policies for alcohol prevention and control. Alcohol consumption has more effect on job productivity than on number of workdays missed, with associated costs being about half of the total social cost of alcohol in the EU. From an analysis of effective policies across Europe a set of policy measures will be developed for uptake in large employers and SMEs. Both strands of work will draw from data from a series of systematic reviews, analyses of existing grey literature, key informants’ interviews and bring in knowledge and know-how from other partners in the international consortium, to finally triangulate all the evidence to develop key recommendations for the EU. The candidate will be responsible for the development of several systematic literature reviews and the coordination of interviews with key European stakeholders, preparing publications and reports, and the day to day running of the project. S/he will also contribute and be engaged to different extents in other ongoing projects and proposals, European research and collaborations. We are looking for a candidate with strong skills and track record in undertaking systematic literature reviews ideally with publication experience. Skills would include analyses of contextual and policy contexts, and understanding of the health/alcohol field and the broader socio-economic and sustainability 2030 Agenda and discourse. S/he will have excellent oral and written communication skills in English, strong qualitative analytic skills and flexibility for international work. The job position is based in ESADE (Barcelona and Sant Cugat Campus) with home working in the current COVID-19 situation. The position is offered for 1.5 years, starting beginning of November 2020. Salary full time starts at 25.000€ year, according to experience. Please send your CV and cover letter to Eva Jané Llopis (********** ). Please state “RESEARCH POSITION_2021_002EJ” in the subject of your email. Job Work Location Personal Assistance locations The responsibility for the jobs published on this website, including the job description, lies entirely with the publishing institutions. The application is handled uniquely by the employer, who is also fully responsible for the recruitment and selection
Industries: Gestión de organizaciones sin ánimo de lucro, Enseñanza superior, Investigación

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Barcelona
Description: XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future – for a better working life!   XING provides advice and support to its more than 18 million members during the upheaval processes in the world of work. In an environment marked by a shortage of skilled workers, digitalization, and changes in values, XING helps its members achieve as harmonious a work/life balance as possible: For a better working life.   Data Scientist (m/f/d)  XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future – for a better working life! We currently have an opening for a Software Engineer in Spain. At XING Spain, we are responsible for the development of all XING's E-Recruitment offerings, including our flagship recruitment product the XING Talent Manager or new innovative products, such as the XING Referral Manager. These define the social recruiting market in the German speaking area with high relevance and transparency for the jobseeker. The combination of E-Recruiting and Social Networking is an exciting emerging market. We are seeking a Data Scientist who helps with designing algorithms/models and implementing these algorithms/models into production services. If you want to get things done rather than sit in meetings, like helping others and learning from them, you will have fun in our team!   A challenging task  Solve challenging problems in the context of search, recommender systems and machine learning  Perform analyses on massive amounts of data and build scalable machine learning models, ranking algorithms and help automating machine learning processes  Develop new and enhance algorithms and services using technologies such as Scala, elasticsearch, and Hadoop technologies (e.g. Hive, MapReduce)   A convincing background  MSc or PhD in Computer Science or similar discipline  Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g. with SQL, Python, R, Hive, etc.)  Theoretical and practical knowledge in information retrieval or machine learning  Practical working experience in implementing (scalable) models and algorithms which process large datasets  Programming skills, preferably in Scala or Python.  Proficient English language skills (German is not required)  An inspiring environment  A great, multicultural and diverse environment.  Flexible working hours and some days “work from home”.  Restaurant tickets.  A mobile device of your choice as well for private use (iPhone, iPad, Android…).  A sunny office located in the center of Barcelona, with a large terrace.  Flexible Compensation Plan: Health insurance/ Transport/ Nursery Tickets  Extended holidays  Competitive salary and a Permanent contract  Bicycle park and package reception  Large, highly distributed platform with over 18 million users.  A variety of technologies and languages: Ruby on Rails, Node, Java, Scala, Elasticsearch, REST, React, AMQP, Linux, Hadoop, Riak, MongoDB, MySQL, Solr, iOS, Android, Backbone.js, Git, Jenkins…  Relocation pack if needed. Title: Researcher - alcohol policy research
Description: The Center for Leadership at ESADE Business School is searching for a Post-doc or Master’s Graduate (including those with interest in pursuing a PhD), to join Alhambra, a project tendered by the European Commission (EC) to address 6 large inter-connected alcohol policy research areas with regards to European alcohol production, sales, consumption and policy responses. The candidate will join the research group in ESADE and the larger international research team of Alhambra.  In Alhambra, ESADE is responsible for two distinct areas of work. The first aims to assess the alcohol impacts beyond the health sector, and highlight the centrality of Health in All Policies for addressing alcohol related harm, like considering health impacts in marketing, taxation, agriculture, education etc. This work will further unpack alcohol’s impact on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), looking into its negative economic and social consequences loss of earnings, unemployment, family problems, violence, crime, stigma, barriers to healthcare, as well as the broader environment, biodiversity, water and food resources, climate, cities, etc.). Unravelling the interrelations between alcohol and the SDGs, its positive and negative impacts and related socio-economic externalities, and how this links to non-health policies will inform the development of a compelling case for: Alcohol In All relevant Policies. A second area of work addresses workplace policies for alcohol prevention and control. Alcohol consumption has more effect on job productivity than on number of workdays missed, with associated costs being about half of the total social cost of alcohol in the EU. From an analysis of effective policies across Europe a set of policy measures will be developed for uptake in large employers and SMEs. Both strands of work will draw from data from a series of systematic reviews, analyses of existing grey literature, key informants’ interviews and bring in knowledge and know-how from other partners in the international consortium, to finally triangulate all the evidence to develop key recommendations for the EU.  The candidate will be responsible for the development of several systematic literature reviews and the coordination of interviews with key European stakeholders, preparing publications and reports, and the day to day running of the project. S/he will also contribute and be engaged to different extents in other ongoing projects and proposals, European research and collaborations.  We are looking for a candidate with strong skills and track record in undertaking systematic literature reviews ideally with publication experience. Skills would include analyses of contextual and policy contexts, and understanding of the health/alcohol field and the broader socio-economic and sustainability 2030 Agenda and discourse. S/he will have excellent oral and written communication skills in English, strong qualitative analytic skills and flexibility for international work. The job position is based in ESADE (Barcelona and Sant Cugat Campus) with home working in the current COVID-19 situation.  The position is offered for years, starting beginning of November 2020. Salary full time starts at year, according to experience.  Please send your CV and cover letter to Eva Jané Llopis (). Please state “RESEARCH POSITION_2021_002EJ” in the subject of your email.
Industries: Gestión de organizaciones sin ánimo de lucro, Enseñanza superior, Investigación

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description: LIFULL Connect is a Global Marketplace Group that operates more than 250 vertical search sites across property, employment, motoring, and fashion in 63 different countries and 24 different languages. These sites operate under the Trovit, Mitula, Nestoria, Nuroa, and Fashiola brands. In addition, our network of 22 property portals in South-East Asian and Latam countries under DotProperty and Resem groups, help people find their next home. Our mission is to connect people and help them make some of the biggest decisions in their life. Want to know more about Lifull Connect?  We are an innovative and creative team, we look for team players, humble, self-responsible, curious, passionate, happy, proactive, and willing to roll up their sleeves people.  Our team context:  Our team has a big challenge in the company that is to contribute to our culture of data-driven decision making. We are owners to build and maintain an unified data analytics platform for Lifull Connect. We are starting in this challenge and we would like to join new members that are enthusiasts in data engineering and data analysis. We work with continuous delivery and minimum viable product. We are building the data platform by use cases. We are building it iteratively, learning, validating and growing our platform by each use case. Ideally, we are looking for someone who is near our Barcelona or Madrid office. We are open to remote work, but, from time to time, we need to see each other in person.  What we will do together:  Building an unified data analytics platform for Lifull Connect using technologies like AWS S3, Glue, Redshift, Spark, SQL.Building a data lake using AWS S3.Building an ingestion layer to the data lake using products like Stitch, Fivetran.Building a data warehouse using Redshift.Building data pipelines using products like DBT, Glue ETL, Talend.Design and development the data quality strategy.Working closely with the product and BI teams to mentor and give support to them to use the unified data analytics platform.  What we expect from you:  Experience with Cloud Data Platform environments (preferred AWS).Experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (preferred Redshift).Experience with data pipelines and ETL’s.Experience to integrate third products like Stitch, Fivetran, dbt.SQL knowledge.Rock solid computer science knowledge and a passion for data.Love to code and taking care of performance, testability and design.A problem solver with a devops mindset.  What’s a plus but not mandatory:  Experience with data catalogs like AWS Glue Catalog.Experience creating a data quality strategy for providing robust data.Strong SQL knowledge and perform complex queries.Experience with monitoring tools like CloudWatch, Grafana.  What we offer you:  The most important thing that we offer at LIFULL Connect is an environment where everyone has the possibility to grow and make an impact. We have a big growth challenge ahead of us and we are willing to walk that path and achieve our objectives. We are firm teamwork believers and we like to push ourselves to do better while enjoying the journey!  Some of the things that will help you perform at your best (aka benefits & perks):  An inspiring office with different spaces to help us focus and collaborate.Free snacks and beverages.In-house gym.Training Budget.Private medical insurance.Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant, Transport, Kindergarten).Team building events, like afterworks and outings.  Sounds like you? Then let's talk!  Powered by JazzHR  N0JCfs7eWB
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Internet, Bienes inmobiliarios

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description: Applies  advanced  subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower level employees.  Responsibilities  Leads complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, and identifies recommendations and insights.  Works independently to construct highly complex statistical and financial models to forecast business performance: coaches others on model development.  Establishes the metrics required to measure business performance, and develops the process for identifying and addressing performance gaps.  Manages complex, time- sensitive market research projects and prepares synthesized intelligence reports with clear implications.  Leads cross-functional teams across the entire span of business planning activities.  Contributes to priority projects by adding creative insights and developing recommendations.  Partners with business leaders to develop business plans and proactively identify new opportunities.  Develops go-forward business plan recommendations based on potential risks and returns.  Identifies cutting-edge analytical tools, models, and methods for making key business decisions.   Education And Experience Required  Typically 6-10 years work experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area. Advanced university degree (e.g., MBA) or demonstrable equivalent.  Knowledge And Skills  Extensive knowledge of research methodology for key business issues.  Excellent analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.  Ability to leverage new analytical techniques to develop creative approaches to business analysis.  Extensive knowledge and understanding of how to analyse business problems using Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modelling.  Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Very strong project management skills, including leading large, cross-functional initiatives.  Strong relationship management skills, including partnering and consulting.  Developed leadership skills, including team-building, conflict resolution, and management.  Ability to identify emerging trends from market and industry data.  Ability to apply advanced statistical methodologies such as mixed model (random and fixed effects), simultaneous equations, time series based methods (ARIMA, Causal Autoregressive Mixed Models), neural networks, and multinomial discrete choice. Experience developing and implementing machine learning techniques in real time (e.g. API, PMML, Java, C, RPMML).  Advanced hands on experience in Statistical Software (e.g. SAS, R, Python) and big data environments (e.g. cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure), and on-prem (e.g. Hadoop).  Ability to comprehend and apply principles of advanced calculus, machine learning and advanced other statistical theory.  Work effectively in cross-functional teams, having demonstrated strong partnerships with both internal and external business partners and alliances.  Demonstrated ability to collect and organize data, work effectively with complex relational databases, conduct analysis and report on and apply results to “actionable insights/recommendations.” Solid data modelling experience is required with proven application in applying Decision Trees, Regression analysis, Neural Network and other data mining techniques, experience with time series and experimental design.
Industries: Marketing y publicidad, Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software

Title: Data Engineer-Oracle Developer
Description: En Gfi Buscamos Perfiles De  Data Engineer expertos en desarrollar en Oracle, PL/SQl, y Tableau para importante proyecto internacional dentro del sector bancario.  Funciones  Actualización y creación de procesos Oracle diarios. Optimización del proceso existente. Crear nuevos ETL a partir de diferentes fuentes de datos. Creación y optimización de fuentes de datos para el equipo de visualización. Desarrollo de métricas, informes, cuadros de mando y visualización para diferentes stakeholders y departamentos. Incluye la distribución, el mantenimiento y la validación de estos informes y cuadros de mando.  Requisitos  Perfil proactivo y dinámico, con capacidad de interlocución, con experiencia en informes y desarrollo. Desarrollador experto en Oracle, ETL, creando y actualizando procesos diarios. PL / SQL, Tableau, Java, JavaScript, secuencias de comandos Unix, jsp, html, Python Inglés alto (se utilizará a diario y desde el primer día puesto que trabajarán junto con equipos internacionales europeos y estadounidenses) Lugar de trabajo: Madrid (inicialmente se teletrabajará)  Se Ofrece  Contrato Indefinido Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento Plan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes. Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc. Flexibilidad horaria  Anímate a Echarle Un Vistazo a Nuestra Microsite  http://www.trabajaren.gfi.es/            Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas           Data Analyst, HTML, Java / J2EE, JavaScript, PL/SQL, SQL, Python, Oracle, JSP / Servlets, Oracle, Unix, Tableau

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description: Descripción de la empresa  Adevinta is an international group present in 16 countries, and we are sure that you know our brands in Spain: fotocasa, habitaclia, InfoJobs, coches.net, motos.net, milanuncios, and vibbo, reach more than 18 million unique users per month: we are one of the top 10 companies with the largest internet audience in Spain! This and our more than 1,000 employees make us one of the leading tech companies on the Spanish market.  As a tech company, we have digital DNA. We love challenging the status quo and we are constantly thinking of new ways of doing things.We work using PEAK Performance, a streamlined way of working based on OKRs, and self-sufficient and self-organising teams. We believe in a culture of feedback and a close leadership style. In short, we create ever smarter solutions to offer our users and clients the best experience.  If you like challenges and believe in the power of connection as much as we do...Join our team!  Descripción del empleo  We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer for the Data Platform team. You will be responsible for fostering cooperation between the different Data teams, working closely with them to make our strategy and vision a reality.  We hope that the architecture and design of the platform will emerge from this collaboration. Therefore, one of your main tasks will be to lead the Data community with passion and by example.  Your Main Responsibilities Will Be  Design and development You will have to know in depth the technologies available in the market to provide an updated, efficient, safe and adapted to the needs of the company.You will work hand to hand with the engineering teams analyzing, designing and implementing the necessary solutions to bring us to the ideal solution.Understand and comprehend the real needs of the business to ensure the developments and guarantee the resolution for the requests from our users.You must have a complete vision of the systems and tools involved in the technological solutions necessary for the development of the platform. Leadership and creation You will participate in the definition and execution of the Data strategy, identifying and offering solutions to all the proposed needs, both present and future, guaranteeing the methodologies, training, platforms, support...Promote in the Data community the best bases for the development and programming of the proposed solutions. Promote continuous improvement as the basis for the growth of Adevinta's professionals.Help to define good practices in the use of the data platform as well as the processes that are executed in it. Coordination and evolution Ensure alignment with all data teams, promoting interactions and teamwork.To be the image of Data in the community of Adevinta, promoting collaboration between the different organizations of the company.Share experiences and learning, successes and failures to take advantage of them in the different teams of the company. Títulos Excellent communication skills and great ability to work effectively in a team and facilitate the work environment of the company.Mentoring Data Platform team members in application architecture, design and development best practices.To have the ability to analyze, design, define, manage and optimize complex data flow solutions.To assist the different teams of Data (Engineers, Insights, Scientists, Analysts) to create the processes to obtain, transform and visualize data.Extensive experience as a Data Engineer in Batch and Real Time processes.Experience optimizing Data Pipelines with Spark, Hadoop...To facilitate tools for data generation guaranteeing its quality with the objective of being useful for the users and the company's teams.Experience in data and clustering platform technologies Hadoop, Hive, Yarn...Demonstrable experience in AWS, EMR, Redshift environments.Knowledge of pipelines with Kafka, Airflow, etc.Experience in RealTime processes: Kafka, Cassandra, Apache Flink...Experience working with Kubernetes, Travis, SBT, Scala, PySpark, Python, Git...To guarantee and support the teams in the definition and implementation of Testing (Unit/Integration/Functional)Experience in continuous integration environments CI/CD (Accelerate)Data Catalog/Lineage/Literacy  Información adicional Work with excellent professionals to solve hard technical challenges.Be part of a company with an excellent working environment and modern, creative offices.Opportunities for development and growth within the company and the international group.Flexible working hours 8-10h / 17-19hFriday afternoons off.23 paid vacation days a year, plus the 24th and 31st of December off.Intensive workday during summer months and Easter (34h work week).Medical insurance.Attractive remuneration according to your experience.MacBook Pro or Dell equivalent laptop + iPhone XR or Samsung S10.Flexible compensation
Industries: Internet

Title: Predoctoral Researcher - Murcia
Description: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia (UCAM) is seeking to appoint  Predoctoral Researcher to join the project 'Innovative modelling approaches for predicting socio-environmental evolution in highly anthropized coastal lagoons' (SMARTLAGOON) funded by the European Union within the call 'Environmental Intelligence' (H2020-FETPROACT-2018-2020).  The selected candidate will be in charge of the hydrological modeling of the Campo de Cartagena basin through SWAT+ and the simulation of different scenarios to analyze the environmental sustainability of the basin.  Offer Requirements  REQUIRED LANGUAGES ENGLISH: Excellent SPANISH: Excellent  Skills/Qualifications  We are looking for an ambitious and highly motivated student with the following qualifications:  A degree in civil engineering, earth sciences or similar.  Previous experience in hydrological modeling.  Skilled in computer programming and data analytics.  Strong written and oral English skills.  Good communication skills with experience in scientific publishing.  Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Enseñanza superior, Investigación, Biotecnología

Title: Senior User Experience Researcher - Barcelona
Description: The Role  We are looking for a highly talented and passionate User Experience Researcher who embraces a problem-solving culture and is obsessed with keeping the customer at the heart of our products. You will partner with cross-functional teams across the company in multiple research projects to uncover customer needs and validate solutions.  Our ideal UX Researcher has a strong grasp of User Experience and Visual Design fundamentals, the perfect combination to inspire and leverage our product strategy into a more human-centered approach while aligning on the business objectives.  Responsibilities  Plan and conduct user research projects throughout the end-to-end product lifecycle: from ideation, design and validation of prototypes, all the way to usability tests on the final product.  Combine diverse quantitative and qualitative research methods and derive insights from them, either conducted on your own or in partnership with other members of the team.  Work closely with designers, product managers, engineers, marketers and data scientists to deliver actionable insights and a high-quality user experience.  Empathize with both users and buyers, having a deep understanding of the objectives and goals of each one when interacting with our products.  Advocate for product highest quality, always striving to produce aesthetically pleasing and usable products.  Evangelize User Experience design across the whole company, applying processes like Design Thinking to solve business problems.  Participating in both the interaction and visual design of the products, helping to define consistent UI components and guidelines following well-established patterns and standards. What do we expect from you  Enthusiasm, creativity, and outstanding interpersonal skills  Excellent communication skills: listening, understanding, and persuading  Self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision  Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills  Creative thinker with a vision  Attention to details  Advanced English skills - for interaction with customers, peers, and stakeholders.  Requirements  Proven experience of 4+ years in UX solving complex user and customer problems backed with research.  Experience with prototyping tools like Adobe XD or Invision.  Experience researching and designing for B2B SaaS products is a plus. What we offer  A fun fast-paced startup environment with an extraordinary team, team buildings, and free coffee/tea   Friday reduced working hours (9 am to 3.30 pm)  Reduced working hours during August to enjoy summer  A sunny office with a large terrace, based in the center of Barcelona, right next to Sants train station  Private health insurance covered by the company  Tax relief on restaurants, travel, and childcare  Gym membership to access all DiR gyms in Catalonia and selected YogaOne Centres in Barcelona for a ridiculous price Feel like this job is for you? Apply now!

Conocer el estado del arte de la tecnología, las diferentes plataformas existentes y sus aplicaciones y casos de uso.  Colaborar en el análisis de requerimientos, diseño y definición de la arquitectura y desarrollo del software de los proyectos  Desarrollar e implementar soluciones innovadoras que utilicen los diferentes tipos de tecnología  Diseñar pruebas de concepto.  Colaboración en la preparación de propuesta y gestión de proyectos de I+D nacionales y europeos.

Title: CLOUD DATA ENGINEER AWS / AZURE
Description: Descripción  ¡Lo conseguimos! Por quinto año consecutivo, certificados como mejor compañía donde trabajar en España, te apetece empezar a disfrutar? #TopEmployer #Bestplacetowork.  Technology & Advanced Solutions (T&AS) es el área de everis dedicado al desarrollo de proyectos de transformación digital bajo un ambiente disruptivo, innovador gracias a la aplicación de las soluciones o tecnologías más emergentes del mercado. Somos el top of mind de nuestros clientes.  Te gusta estar a la última dentro del mundo del dato?, Te apasiona la tecnología y la innovación?  Ofrecemos la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente en proyectos punteros, innovadores y tecnológicamente complejos en clientes de diferentes sectores, adquiriendo conocimientos en las más avanzadas tecnologías.  Participarás en el desarrollo de aplicaciones de datos sobre arquitecturas cloud, trabajarás en aportar soluciones tanto streaming, como batch, dentro de equipos agile multidisciplinares, conceptualizando la solución, definiendo y aplicando la metodología de uso de la tecnología.  Trabajamos en entornos smart working, flexible, con máxima conciliación, oficinas nuevas y equipos horizontales. En everis abunda la buena gente y buen ambiente, donde se rema en la misma dirección para que todas las personas desarrollen su carrera profesional, con revisión anual y feedback continuo. Además, contarás en un mentor que te ayudará en cada paso y/o decisión que tomes.  Requisitos  Experto en soluciones sobre plataforma AWS (EMR, Glue, S3, Redshift, Athena, etc) o plataforma Azure (Datalake, Datawarehouse, Blob Storage, CosmosDB, etc…)Al menos 5-6 años de experiencia en desarrollo de software en proyectos de datos.Experiencia en haber participado en proyectos complejos.Experiencia en la conceptualización, diseño e implementación de arquitecturas de datos.Conocimiento contrastado de Java, Python, Scala o Spark, Databricks.Conocimientos avanzados de Base de Datos (relacionales, NoSql,…).Conocimiento de integración continua y DevOps (Jenkins, GitLab,..) y IaC (Terraform).  Retribución y beneficios  Te ofrecemos retribución competitiva y contrato estable desde el primer día. Además recibes otros beneficios como dietas, seguro médico, seguro de vida y accidentes. Ligado a uno de nuestros valores, la Libertad Responsable, tendrás flexibilidad horaria, opción de teletrabajo así como vestimenta flexible.  Desarrollo profesional  Un plan de desarrollo individualizado para que desarrolles todo tu potencial. Gracias a nuestra everis University y partnership podrás obtener certificaciones y formación específica adaptadas a tus necesidades.  Tecnologías & Proyectos  El candidato se desenvolverá en ecosistemas Big Data y lenguajes de programación distribuida y funcional. Participará en el desarrollo de soluciones de tratamiento del dato tanto, para soluciones streaming como batch, dentro de equipos ágiles multidisciplinares. Title: PHD RESEARCHER ON MULTIMODAL TECHNIQUES OF COGNITIVE PROCESSES
Description: EURECAT SEEKS FOR A POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCHER ON MULTIMODAL TECHNIQUES FOR REMOTE AND FIELD MEASUREMENTS OF COGNITIVE\/AFECCTIVE PROCESSES.  Eurecat is looking for a experienced researchers to applyfor individual fellowships to the MARIE SKOLODOWSKA-CURIE action's TECNIOSPRING (Incoming modality) provided by the Catalan Government.  About The Project  The fellow will have the opportunity to develop research in the fields of experimental psychology\/cognitive neuroscience, artificial intelligence and machine learning, and multimedia, towards the development of tools and techniques for robust measurement of emotional\/cognitive reactions through common sensor devices such as cameras, microphones, accelerometers, etc. by means on the application of signal processing and machine learning methodology and techniques.  The overarching goal is to be able to mimic as much as possible the psychological laboratory in remote testing sessions and field studies relying mainly on audiovisual signals, but also considering wearable physiological devices. Although this kind of research has been on the agenda for many fields such as affective computing for a few years now, the situation induced by the inception of the COVID19 has increased the need to advance in this direction.  Concretely, this project will deal with the establishment of a formal machine learning framework to analyze affective-related audiovisual metrics, such as human expressions, poses and verbal\/vocal activity. Physiological signals, such as activation (arousal) and hedonic value (valence) will act as ground truth, with the aim of detecting specific cognitive-emotional states with as much robustness as possible.
Functions: Investigación, Análisis, Tecnología de la información
Industries: Servicios y tecnologías de la información, Software, Investigación
